text: Me and my lady used to come to this spot at least once a month for the amazing sushi. This all changed as of last night as we are currently looking for a new spot. Owner and sushi chef were a little hmmmm let's just say messed up from a tiny bit to much drinking, along comes customer to my left ( we sat in the middle of two different groups at the sushi bar ) drinking and having shots with the head chef, some conversation about where they are from is exchanged and then escalates to the head chef cussing him out taking his shirt off to show his tattoos, which ended up in customer to my right coming out of no where and playing referee for customer and Mr Head Chef who has been in jail and is from LA. Now I'm from LA myself and don't need to hear your story about what part your from or what gang you rolled with when you were younger, years in jail etc.  I don't normally go out of my way to write many reviews and I loved this place for years but if you are thinking about going here I would say try somewhere else !

This place is one of the best sushi restaurants in Las Vegas.  The staff is super friendly and the sushi is some of the best in town.  Great variety, fresh fish and the presentation is beautiful!  Prices are great as well.  You have to try it!

No AYCE option. :( BUT the fish is extremely fresh. The freshest I've seen around town. The prices are a bit higher than other sushi places but that's ok with me if the quality is great. The staff is really nice and friendly. Definitely try this place out if you're looking for really fresh sashimi and sushi!

Happy hour is a must!!!!  I'm a die hard Japanese foos fan and I when I went there during happy hour I couldn't believe when I saw the menu.  Lots of options! Yummy! Shame there isn't any sashimi in it!

Hokaido Sushi is life changing. Chicken soup for the sushi lover's soul. Candy for people who love it in its purest, authentic form. A trip to the shores of Japan, New Zealand, Washington state, and Korea for people who can't splurge for the plane ticket or haven't renewed their passports. This place has a loyal following at the sushi bar which must be chalked up to their sushi chefs, especially head chef Sam. He is bar none the best.  Our group of four sat at the bar and ordered omakase. My husband is a diehard sushi purist and can't stop raving about the quality and taste of the fish. The entire omakase was the bomb - there's simply no better way to describe it - but if we had to pick standouts they would include the toro (fatty tuna), salmon belly, wild king salmon from New Zealand, uni from the Channel Islands, Shigoku oysters from Washington, and hamachi with thin silver of jalape√±o and cilantro. Basically find a place at the bar with Sam and he will treat you right. He may even recommend fresh fish off menu if it's available. The omakase is very reasonable - $28 pp for 10 pieces.   My only regret is that we don't live in Vegas and therefore can't come once a week. If my husband ever went missing, Hokaido is the first place I'd check.   Thank you Sam for a masterful meal.  Save a seat for us at the bar- we'll be back!!!
The value and taste of hakkaido cannot be beat. The happy hour is very cheap yet the sushi is still some of the best in Vegas. I highly recommend Hokkaido

My sister n law got me hooked to Hokaido Sushi  Super yummy! Literally come in once a week for their HAPPY HOUR ! Definelty a nice place to have a relaxing meal.  You have to try the Darkhorse roll and spicy crab roll is always a favorite.
I've frequented this restaurant for a few years. Good food and friendly service. For great locals sushi on the west side you can't go wrong.
Nice little cozy place with friendly staff. Wide sushi selection.
Please, please, please get a second server! Service is too slow with the single server all day.  Food is fantastic for all ages!

Great spot for affordable sushi, but beyond that the staff is really friendly and accommodating.  The sushi rolls are fresh and there are so many great combinations to choose from. In just the few visits I've had I have found three rolls that are my new all time favorite. Plus the garlic edamame for an appetizer is so delicious. Did I mention friendly? Whether you're at the sushi bar or sitting at a table in the dining area all staff is very attentive and makes you feel invited and comfortable.

I had to join Yelp to give them a review. Because the new owner does not welcome local guests who do not want his special dishes that he said its special, but I didn't see anything special about it, but the price.  We didn't think bill came up over $300 for 3of us. We did not eat that much, and I did not see anything special.  I get it was slow night, but they did not supose to up selling their dishes without telling us how much it is.  We were surprised when we got our check.  Too much.  Ownership must have changed, it was not like this before.  Not recommended, we can find better, and cheaper sushi bar, I  am never going back to this place ever.

I took a friend with me on the 14th of September and found few customers in the Restaurant. Only my second visit, my first was on a different day and was crowded. I ordered my favorite Hamachi and was disappointed with the flavor. It had a strange aftertaste I could not pinpoint but, the second order was more the normal. Both were not the usual and delicate sweetness. The stringed seaweed was outstanding, the  Mizo soup delicious and the dishes the waitress recommended to my friend were greatly enjoyed by him. With the present state of the Oceans and products taken from them; quality worldwide is not what it used to be. I refer to my experience dating between 2000 all the way back to 1969. Our waitress was extremely helpful, the environment clean and I will be back for another round of Hamachi and more very soon. Looking forward to a better cut and flavor next trip.
I love this place. It's good every time I come here. Rocky and Su are awesome sit with them at the bar !!

The fish is not appetizing and everything was soggy. I am extremely disappointed because I didn't expect for a basic spicy tuna roll could taste so bad. I feel like the fish wasn't fresh and could be so much better if it was. we ordered the tiger roll, paradise, Hawaiian and dark horse. It all tasted the same and drenched in the sweet sauce. It was like they were trying to hide the fact that the tuna and salmon wasn't fresh.
Great sushi fantastic service chefs are so talented and friendly only place I go for sushi
Can't go wrong with the Udon!!!! Chicken Katsu is their best. For Bento plate best deal is at lunch time.
Sushi is great! This place is awesome for groups and the food overall is really good. Also try the udon soup!!

I love this place so much! Will go in for lunch as many times as I can afford it. It's not an ayce place, so normally get garlic tuna nigiri, churchy philly roll and alternate the other. One time I got the volcano roll and it came out in a beautiful presentation complete with flames!!  I was so impressed with their plating   Super clean tables and restaurant, attentive servers, quick drink refills, and quick service especially when your on your lunch break   Everything I have ever gotten from here was amazing.  Eta: I took advantage of their happy hour specials today (after 2pm) and the prices were great!!  Will be going back for that :)
I love this place...they have some of the best sushi. Order the Double D...it comes with a screaming orgasm sauce that puts an extra kick to your tastebuds.

This is without a doubt the best sushi I have ever had.  The chefs are outstanding and have the freshest fish and most awesome service possible.  Everything I have had from the menu has been great, but where Hokaido really shines is their specials. I generally order from the specials and have had more amazing fish since going there than I have had my entire life.  I drive up from Phoenix just to go here.

I LOVE the salmon teriyaki bento but they give such a tiny piece that it makes me so upset. I had given them a chance atleast 5 times... instead I just order their shrimp and vegetable tempura bento, it is delicious. I would give them 3.5 Stars but yelp has no 1/2 stars...because when i complained about the salmon, the lady cook came out and started yelling at me!! Rude!
It took 30 mins for 2 pieces of uni. The hell.. never again. And the place wasn't even busy.

This place is possibly the best sushi I've had in Vegas since moving here over 2 years ago.  First off, this place is not AYCE, and I don't care, they're worth every penny.  The quality of the fish I had tonight was superb, and the selection was impressive.  I didn't order any rolls, but the people at the sushi bar next to me did and they looked wonderful.  Another important thing to note is the knife skills here, each slice of fish they cut was almost identical, and they didn't over-rice the nigiri or hand rolls.  Overall, this place gets top marks in my books, and some of the sushi chefs around town could definitely come here for lessons.
I really enjoy this place. Great happy hour. Angela, Jennifer and Rocky are amazing. It's very hospitable here. Best garlic edamame I've ever had.
Some of the best sushi I've ever had.  The presentation of the sushi is incredible and prices are very reasonable. Chefs Eric and JJ made it very fun too. Great Place!

Sushi in LV for me has been just ok so far. I've been here 3 months, not long, I know, but I have tried several places and they seem exactly alike and simply nothing that special. I've been to Hokaido 3 times, and it's been consistently good. They have a great menu, good portions of fresh fish (nothing worse than paper thin fish on a nigiri), and it's a comfortable place.  For me, the Dark Horse roll gets Hokaido that extra star - shrimp tempura, crab, and avocado roll topped with toasted coconut and some sort of yummy sauce. This roll makes it worth the trip every time.
Awesome. I'll come back pretty soon for eating fantastic sushi and rolls. I've never been great sushi place like here!

I don't understand. I thought this place was good. The service was really slacking and our food took forever to come out. Chirashi bowl doesn't even use sushi rice. It is just plain rice with furikake on it. So it tastes horrible. And the price did not justify the quality of the fish!! Don't think I'll be coming back here for awhile...

This is hands down the best sushi in las vegas! I've gone here a dozen times and they never let me down. Presentation, taste, atmosphere, and staff is all on point. My fav is the q roll, but so many more rolls are phenomenal. I've been to a lot of sushi restaurants and although I try to find other restaurants that compare and nothing ever comes close! Hokaido!! You rock :)

I've been to Hokaido few times for lunch and dinner. They always have fresh and special fishes. The dish was excellently prepared. It was juicy and there was no hint of any fishiness. I love their oysters too! I definitely recommend this place! :)
The service is great and the food is always amazing! Good assortment for happy hour and the sauce on their cucumber salad is just out of this world!
This place is delicious. Quiet environment and friendly staff. Chef created awesome rolls according to what we liked. "I like your ass" roll is a must. The garlic tuna is perfect. Def recommend!
Food is decent. Fish was fresh. Service was fine. There wasn't a lot of people for lunch. We didn't do AYCE, as we weren't that hungry. Would probably eat here again if we were nearby.
Everyone is super nice super sweet!!   They food is to die for!!! Everything in the menu is amazing

Very good sushi at a fair price.   Eating sushi in the desert is fairly daring proposition as I've found most sushi joints around Vegas being subpar.   Hokaido is our spot. The fish is fresh and JJ is the  best I've seen in Vegas. Only Philly and California have beaten this place for sushi from what I've found.   I definitely prefer this to all other SW sushi spots.

I loved the food here!  The sushi was very fresh. We had the 300, happy ending and another one with veggies that was just wonderful.  Also...had the peanut butter mochi for dessert.  Never had PB mochi before and it was really really good! I will definitely be back to this place! My only complaint was that the service was a little on the slow side, but other than that it was great!

because of good reviews, I went to this place with my friend. not too crowded on a Friday night. We thought we would try it, what a bad decision.ordered iced tea, got a sprite, took them a long time to bring our food, for that tiny little pieces, bit pricy. no all u can eat.      spent $70 for two people before tip, left hungry. was afriad to order more, didn't want to wait another 30 mins. so disappointed. went to Mc Donalds to satisfy hungry belly. never go back again.

I live 3 minutes from here and have eaten sushi all over city. This place and Bocho downtown are amazing!!!  Fresh great fish and they have brown rice for all you healthy eaters.  Hands down one of best in Vegas!

This is the best Sushi spot I've visited in Vegas, it's ALWAYS fresh. I usually call in, and order to go for lunch, or when I have family or friends visiting.  The prices are not to bad, they have an excellent happy hour menu.

I use to come here almost every week. That was 4 years ago & it was mine and my moms favorite place!   I stopped goin for about 2 years. And my boyfriend and i recently started going again.. We went for happy hour~ half price on most rolls. But guess what? Its also HALF of a roll not a whole roll. I have NEVER seen any sushi restaurant do that before. The service was also terrible. We thought okay whatever its close & sushi is decent. So we went back a few weeks later. Still terrible, nothing has changed... I was so sad because i really wanted to love it like i use to.   Tonight we decided to get it one more time because we didnt want to drive all the way to our usual sushi spot... I got chicken teriyake, what can go wrong with chicken teriyake right? WRONG! There were glumps of the sauce on top of my chicken. Really wth glumps??? So i jus pushed it to the side.. But the chicken was cold too! I think its safe to say, we're officially done with this place.
Love this restaurant. The food and sushi has always been fresh and well prepared.  Angela is the kindness and best waitress we know there. She's very friendly her service is top notch.

Best sushi in vegas hands down! Super friendly staff, they know me by my name and welcome me with open arms everytime I walk through the door.  I eat there at least once a week.  They do not have all you can eat, but the quality of the rolls is unbeatable.  "The sweetheart" roll is pure heaven.  JJ, Eric Tony are the chefs and are authentically Korean/Japaneese.  Not some mexican in a komono pretending to know how to prepare rolls.  Very clean, no scent to the restruant.  A++++

After today I realized, I've been eating mediocre sushi my whole life. This place is awesome!! The young guy making the sushi was friendly, informative, and a sushi pro. The toro tuna mouth watering and basically melted in my mouth. The halibut from Jeju and the spicy poke salad unforgettable. Loved the Korean beer and soju option also. I will definitely be going back. It's the best sushi I've ever had.   *Ask for some fresh wasabi. So good!!

I'll just say it: there are better sushi restaurants in town. HOWEVER: (1) this place is closest to my house; and (2) they serve brown rice.  So, automatic four stars (yes, I am lazy and needlessly obsessed with blood glycemic levels.)  Moving on from the disclaimer...  Brown rice chirashi exists in this establishment.  Boom, I'm there.  Also, they make a really great non-rice roll called Muchi Muchi.  It involves a sexy union of shrimp tempura and lettuce.  Boom, I'm there.  Sometimes, however, the rice is a little hard, like it's been sitting around for 72 hours. At that point, a single tear rolls down my cheek......
After eating here for many years I decided to finally post a review. Its fantastic quality of fish/Sushi never had a bad meal here. Can't say a negative thing staff is also freidley and professional.

Okay, I gave Hokaido a try this weekend because most of the reviews were favorable. However, I have to say this is the worst sushi I have had in a long time. We ordered the Crazy Horse, spicy tuna, california rolls, and yellowtail sashimi. The raw fish was just awful. The yellowtail and spicy tuna were fishy smelling & the texture was mushy. As for the Crazy Horse, it was fried, so it was hard to really tell what was going on. The california rolls were fine & the habachi rice was good. If you're going for sushi, I would just say that the fish just isn't fresh at all. The worst part about the meal was the very end when I went to the restroom & found it to be dirty and there was no soap in the dispenser. Gross! We were there at 12:30 in the afternoon and the restaurant was close to empty, so the bathroom obviously hadn't been cleaned since the night before. Needless to say, I will not be back.

We'd been looking for a good sushi bar for a long time--real sushi (not just rolls), fresh and tasty sashimi, served by a chef that knows what he's doing and interacts with the customers.  You get all of that at Hokaido.  JJ and Eric provide fantastic service and are a ton of fun to eat with.  The presentation of every dish is top notch and the prices are good.  This has become our regular spot.

Let me say I don't eat sushi. I am writing this for/as my husband. He is a HUGE fan so the first time he went to this place he was excited. He went about 30 minutes before closing time ( which could suck but still) and they refused to service him. About two months later he tried this place again, at an earlier time, during happy hour. Of course they wouldn't let him do happy hour if it was to go. Not only would they not let him do this but they were very very rude. If you run a business and you're food is awesome... That doesn't mean crap if your service is the worst. Don't go here. They are rude and disrespectful. Service sucks here!

Just moved to this part of town so I drove around till I found a place to eat. I saw the sushi sign and decided to give it a try.           I ordered a few dishes, some unagi, a. Hawaiian roll, crunchy ebi roll, and hibachi rice. All of it in my opinion was pretty mediocre.  Not bad, not great, just average.       Having said that the venue is very clean, the waitresses were nice and very attentive. With lots of options to choose from on the menu.        The one thing that really bummed me out is there is no all you can eat sushi option, maybe I'm just a fatty, but I like to try a lot of different rolls. When they are $10 and up its tough to do that and the bill gets really expensive.        Anyways, if you haven't tried it yet I would say give it a go and see for youself, if you're an all you can eat kinda guy like me then save yourself a trip and skip out.
We ate dinner last night here and the food was delicious as always. The soft shell crab is always to die for. Waitress was super friendly.
Very high quality food.  Thr bikini rolls are awesome. The place is kinda pricy but when you try them you'll know why.

I had a mad craving for sushi last night. We thought we'd give a place close to home a try. Hokaido fit the bill. The parking lot was empty which made us a little concerned. We went inside and the dining room was empty, too. Uh-oh. What were we in for?  Variety of offerings is wide. It took us a bit to choose. Finally we settled on chicken udon noodle, and three rolls: Dark Horse, Japanese Lasagna and a classic spicy tuna. We were brought a tasty cucumber salad to get us started. Then, the noodles arrived and the rolls followed.  The noodles were really good, but near impossible to eat with chopsticks. We broke down and asked for a fork.... much easier to enjoy. The lasagna was our least favorite roll, it fell apart easily since it was baked. It was hard to get that perfect bite. Plus, I'm generally not a fan of cream cheese, but it sounded intriguing so I gave it a whirl. Lesson learned--I'm still not much of a fan. The classic spicy tuna was the favorite. Although, the Dark Horse was enjoyable. I especially liked the crunchy texture.  All in all, it was a shame the restaurant was so dead.

We first tried this place in July 2011, because we were looking to go to sushi near our residence.  We went later at night, with not a very busy crowd so we were a little skeptical when we sat down at our table.  They far exceeded our expectations!  We go back very frequently for my absolute favorite sushi ever, the Philly Crunch Roll (a tempura fried philly roll with an amazing sauce).  The presentation is always awesome, except for one time.  The sushi chefs were busy entertaining some guests sitting at the bar, so we didn't get any special plating which was a little disappointing.  They have a wide variety of rolls, and they are usually really friendly.  Everything tastes really fresh (once we did get a spicy yellowtail that tasted a little less than fresh, but one time only).  We usually go around 9-10 pm at night, and its usually not very busy which always surprises me, but maybe its the location.   I would recommend everyone try this place!

I have now been to Hokaido Sushi twice and every time I seem to go it gets better and better. The first time I went it was just my boyfriend and I. I two amazing rolls but can't remember the name and my bf doesn't eat sushi so he had steak and rice, he loved it. Then I went this past Friday with my bf and two friends came into town and they are die hard sushi eaters like me and they loved it. The prices are amazing and the food is totally worth it. I like to sit at the bar and watch them make the food it is fun and they can help you chose something if you don't know what you are really looking for. Best place in Las Vegas so far!

I love this place! The sushi is superb! My girlfriend and I meet here at least twice a month for our sushi fix. Our favorite rolls are Dark Horse and What the Hell. Also, the cucumber salad is to die for! I wish I'd had the recipe. The staff is always nice and very polite. Slight downfall, is the waiting time, even when it's not too busy and an hour lunch break is barely enough to eat great sushi and chat for a bit, if you can get passed the wait (which is well worth it) you'll love this place!
Trying this place for the first time and it was good! However, the salmon sashimi and buttery nipple was okay. My hubby and I enjoyed the Hawaiian roll and the dynamite.

I haven't found a sushi bar out here in Vegas that I have enjoyed since i moved out here this past May, but when I went to Hokaido, found it off Yelp, I was very satisfied. I'm from Chicago, and out there I know of a handful of good sushi places out there. I'm sure there are good places out here in Vegas, and in time i'm sure i'll find good places, but this place was awesome! I was out with my sweetheart and we started out with the beef asparagus rolls...yummy! The cucumber salad was next with the green salad, very good as well. They dressing they used on both, same dressing, was very good. I tried miso soup there and that was standard, and good too. For rolls we got the "chicken teriyaki roll," "what the hell," and the "butter nipple!" They all were fantastic. The staff was very friendly and courteous! Very nice people, very nice place. I definitely will be back, and for now, this place is my favorite sushi place!

Delicious lunch!  I started with the kanpachi  usuzukuri, which was phenomenal.  The sushi chef was quite friendly and gave me a very generous sample of their bluefin tuna, then the toro - yum!  I finished with some nigiri and will definitely go back.  Everything tasted fresh, looked beautiful and the service was very friendly.

I love Hokaido, I have been coming here for 4.5 years! I love the sushi chefs here! Su, Rocky, Ken are wonderful with customer service and friendly. They treat all of my friends like family. I've been invited to there Xmas party when my family was away. I will continue coming here and recommending people to come also. I've recently began eating vegan and they cater to my needs. The shiitake mushroom vegan roll is so delicious!  It's a must to come here!!! They make some amazing custom rolls!

This is a first... I've never been to a sushi joint that showed so much dedication on presentation before! I'm blown away with Hokaido's creativity.   Came here with my cousin for dinner and sat at the sushi bar. We love being up close and personal with the sushi chef ;) haha. Anway, while we both scanned the menu, my cousin noticed the chef prepping something that caught her attention which was the "Marilyn Monroe" roll - tuna, green onion, cucumber, soypaper, spicy scallop. As for me, I ordered the "Dynamite" and "Bikini" roll. The Dynamite - shrimp, scallops, clam & mushroom over rice, baked in a shell. The Bikini roll - spicy soft shell crab, cucumber, shrimp tempura, seared tuna, and avocado.   First reaction as he served us our orders... WOAH. Our food had flowers and carved butterflies out of carrots and radishes!!! Let me repeat.. CARVED BUTTERFLIES! That's talent! xD haha. It made me not want to eat it because it was so pretty. And, the sushi's were absolutely delicious! I mean damn... that was some good shit. Quality of the fish was fresh. Not chewy. Which is super important.  Check list: Customer service - check. Food quality - check. Presentation - check.   Will I return?! OHHHH YEAAAAHH.   *Note to self - Hokaido does not offer AYCE.

Sushi is fresh and comes from premium cuts of fish, rolls are consistent and well balanced. The happy hour is phenomenal and you don't have to crush your stomach by forcing yourself to get your $'s worth at some AYCE joint. Highly recommended. Shoutout to Peter, Su, and Ken the efficient and funny chefs.

Have been there twice and both times very good. Happened to walk in during happy hour and that makes Me happy. Was able to try many new items and not break the bank. Very fresh and flavorful, you won't be disappointed. Highly recommend. Enjoy!!!

First time eating at this place. They offer Happy hour-BONUS. The place look empty. The waitress was nice. The food is really fresh. I had yellow tail sushi and that probably the freshest yellow tail i have had at a good price.  Will come back next time after work before I pick up my kids ( i deserve some quiet time)

Forget the menu, just tell the new sushi chef Sam what you like and be prepared to fall in love. He is so creative and wants you to be delighted. He gives me tastings of everything he thinks I'll like. The place may be a little dated, but I don't care. The look may not be fresh but the fish sure is.

If I could give zero stars i would. Awful awful awful service!  Food was just OK.  Waitress was unbelievably rude.  We finally cancelled our order after waiting over 20 minutes (there were hardly any other people in the restaurant) and they hadn't even started it. I had to actually walk up to the waitress at the counter because she ignored us the whole time.  Don't waste your time when there's a million other sushi restaurants in town.

First time here... The atmosphere was pleasant. We were ordering to go. We aren't sure if the waitress was having a bad day, but she didn't even greet us. She told us to sit and walked away. After ordering, she ignored us until she brought us our food. I would've like to order a drink while we waited but never got a chance to do that.   The food was good overall; some rolls were just okay, my teriyaki beef was amazing. But, even after repeating my order back to me, when I got it, part of it was wrong.   Because of the food, we will try this place again. We're hoping the waitress was just having an off night.

I've had two completely different experiences here!  1st experience: Word to the wise: NEVER COME FOR LUNCH.  It wasn't busy yet when our party of two came in for lunch. She seated us, but we had to flag her down to take our orders for food and drink. The young hostess/server took 25mins to bring our table of two water(we had to remind her) & over 30mins for our food!!! She did not apologize for the wait at all or for bringing our drinks late. I ordered 1 roll and my co-worker ordered 1 lunch special. If it wasn't for us having to flag her down every time we would've taken over an hour on our lunch break. My roll was delish, but not worth the horrid service. That was the worst service I have ever experienced.   2nd experience(for late happy hour): Decided to give this place a second chance with my husband. Boy I felt like I was in a different restaurant! It was fairly busy. The server was different, taller and much more nicer. We enjoyed the happy hour menu but HAD to order my favorite roll that was not part of happy hour. All good. The portions are pretty big as well! My husband and I will definitely comeback, but only late at night, never for lunch!

Fresh sushi at reasonable price. Great happy hour selections, clean restaurant and friendly staff. I like to sit at the bar and interact with the chef, chef Su is very nice, makes us special sushi and makes us feel welcome and appreciated. The Salmon skin salad and salmon belly sushi was amazing. Got too full on happy hour menu, but will definitely go back to try their Uni. So far so good!

Best sushi in Las Vegas.  Eric, one of the sushi chefs is amazing.  So much talent  and so delicous!    The chefs are so creative that your sushi dishes look like a work of art.  The fish is high quality and very, very fresh.  The wait staff are so friendly.   I love this place!

This place has excellent, high quality sushi. Everything from their appetizers to their specialty rolls! I loved the Dark Horse and Red Rock. Their salmon sashimi is also extremely fresh and tasty. Also, to top it off, the service is exceptional. We were there during happy hour and were extremely well taken care of. Tip: go during happy hour - 3 to 6 p.m.

Been here once and everything was great.  We had the kobe sushi, lobster handroll, uni, hawaiian tuna poke, sweet shrimp and everything was really fresh & good~ Tap came to around 70 for all of the above and it was a great value for sushi bar~   Will definitely go back.

The rating tells.  This is a great sushi place in a hole.  Whenever I come to Vegas, this is the place I don't skip.  Yeah, it is a drive from strip but still... Quite honestly, my Sushi buds were trained in Gardena, California (Toyota, Nissan, etc HQ reside right there... you can imagine the level of competition for Sushi place there) And for non all you can eat place to satisfy me does take a LOT. Eric the sushi chef is such an awesome character and creative sushi chef!  He can be wacky at times, can be hilarious, or just friendly as you can get.  But one thing is always certain, he delivers the goodies for your taste buds. Rolls here are just extra ordinary! Beyond 5 stars.  I would rate non-roll sushi typically from 3.5-4.5 stars.  The experience as whole just combines this place as one of the best sushi place you can pick in Las Vegas.
a friend recommanded i try this place out.  loved the rolls. there were so many varieties. the presentation was beautiful and  also very delicious. the sushi was very fresh. would definitely go back.

My 4 year old niece asked me for sushi at 10:55am lol. I was in a a neighborhood I wasn't familiar with so I yelped nearest sushi opening at 11am. Its located right by Kelly Cardenas. I got salmon nigiri. It was decent. I asked the sushi chef what roll didn't have imitation crab. I DO NOT EAT THAT NASTY STUFF. He recommended paradise roll. Again, it was decent. Little fishy tasting. I just feel this place is lackluster. Meh.

This place literally has the best sushi I've ever had!! The tuna sashimi was excellent, even though it was only  three pieces, they are very large. We also had the sexy monkey roll which was to die for, along with the hot special roll. Im telling you, you can't go wrong here.

This place is not bad but they forgot my moms tempura udon soup. Everyone in the restaurant received there food except for my mom, especially the people that came after us and ordered received their food first. This place does not have a good customer service.

Not the worst sushi but definitely better fresher options in town. This is close to my home so for convenience I've been here a few times but after my last experience not sure if I will be going back, they were busy so I get that you can't be completely attentive throughout our whole meal but we felt like the staff was rudely ignoring us. Maybe because we had our young son with us, not sure. They need more staff for weekends and the food is a 3 star in my opinion.
I came back today with my cousin and they changed a new server which is very good although he is still learning. So I'm going to change the review back to five stars. Lol
I love this place. Friendly staff, knowledgeable chefs that will teach you about Sushi. Great food and inexpensive for the quality of product.

A comeback kid. I came here years ago and it smelled like dead fish. But not in a normal good sushi way. I decided to return and ordered the Touchdown among other things. I'll be back for sure. Fish was great, generous plates, normal music.

Oh my WOW!!!!! This place is INCREDIBLE, Just got back from having lunch and was sooooo impressed. Everything was wonderful, the staff was friendly, the presentation was awesome the flavor was delicious but most of all the fish was very fresh.  We will definately be regulars here! LOVED IT!

I'm so happy I found Hodaido Sushi on Yelp!  My guy & I had such a beautiful meal here, and yes, I mean beautiful.  Every dish came out decorated, like something out of "Iron Chef".  The service was amazing, too.  We tend toward the "Kosher" fish... salmon, whitefish, tuna, halibut... and we were completely happy with all of our selections.  Everything was so fresh!     When even the sake tastes better than your old sushi place, you know it's time to make a change.  We'll definitely be heading back to Hokaido soon.    Thanks, Yelp community!

I was pleasantly surprised to stumble into their happy hour and order myself a philly roll. It was $3 and I was expecting my typical, boring, philly roll but honestly it was the best one I've ever had. I'm kicking myself for not ordering a full ($4). I'll be back!!

So far waited 30 minutes and no drinks just sitting here with water one waitress four tables.. got our cucumber salads at 35 minutes.. soup came after our rolls. Drinks came at 40 minutes. This place is super close to our house but we won't be back. There was one waitress who was clearly overwhelmed. Save your money, pay a little more for better food and better service.

Stopped in for happy hour with several friends. Service was pretty good for the most part. Seems most of the rolls on happy hour have shrimp tempura in them. Something to help fill you up & not give you alot of other options of internal ingredients on a roll. Nigiri was good. Had the garlic tuna, salmon belly & super white tuna. Tried the Paradise roll - it was good even though it was shrimp tempura inside. Had asked for fresh wasabi & waitress never informed me there was a charge for it - wished she would have been up front about that. I've ordered fresh wasabi many times & never been charged extra for it so I had no idea that places do charge extra for it - I guess whatever they have to do to make a buck.I'd go back again for happy hour time only.

Kid friendly. Ordered the munchkins chicken teriyaki bento boxes which included miso soup, fruit, salad and shrimp tempura. For desert they had green tea mochi ice cream.  I ordered oysters. The size was too huge for my liking. I noticed oysters are deliciously creamy at a small to medium size. The oysters I had were huge and had a salty fish taste to it. The rest of my order included Salmon Belly, Toro, Red Snapper,  Salmon with yuzo kosho, yellow tail and yellow tail belly all as sushi/nigiri because it fits my budget. This meal was a treat from my dear sister Liza Calove. Thank you Liz.

All I gotta say is this place is awesome. I'm an outta towner that's curious about local scenes and found gold at this decent sushi place. Ladies and gent, this place is it. The ambience is awesome and the sushi chef actually converse and tries to cater sushi to your liking. The pricing is reasonable. Granted this place is not an AYCE, but excellent fresh sushi should be enjoyed in moderation and not in excess.  Great place, great people, fresh fish and excellent ambience from the sushi chef. Highly recommend for anyone looking to experience sushi outside of the Strip.
Excellent food and service! One of the best in town! Highly recommend! Sushi rolls perfectly made every time. Great Happy Hour too!

I love eating at Hokaido Sushi Bar in Summerlin.     Eric the sushi chef makes dishes for me not on the menu all the time. Most times he just takes some of my favorite seafoods and makes me something very delicious. I go wash my hands and he has something for me.  They don't skimp on portions or ingredients. I love love love octopus, and they always give me more than anywhere else.  Consistently GREAT sushi, attentive wait staff, plenty of parking .... and ERIC

I think Naked Fish has a new contender for my favorite sushi roll place.  Hokaido is another surprise in the 'burbs sushi place that had really tasty rolls and fresh fish.  We all shared: 1.  Ultimate Tuna 2.  Three Alarm Fire 3.  Almost Crazy Tuna  All three rolls were fantastically flavorful and well done.  Just enough sauce to rice to fish ratio's.  A bonus was that the uni was unbelievably eye rolling fresh (on a Saturday)!!!!  Conclusion:  I will be back to enjoy more sushi rolls!

came for HH, nice service, food good. California roll, spicey crab and tiger roll. good quality food. I was in the area so stopped by on a quiet Tuesday. no crowd at 2pm. started to get busy later. take out service looked brisk tool  may return if in that area of LV.

Sushi/sashimi was fine, not spectacular, although they have a very extensive menu of rolls and some rice free rolls, which is more up my alley.  Kind of pricey for what you get.  The special blue fin tuna sashimi, was $22.00 and I think we were served less than one ounce of fish. I've had blue fin at other good sushi places, got more and paid less.  Rip.   No AYCE, but a Lunch Menu ranging $13- $16 is good for classic roll lovers that also want miso, salad, and rice included.

Previously gave this place 4 stars only because the servers are always nice and the nigiri tastes great. BUT happy hour menu is limited, rolls are nothing special, and last time I went it was not busy at all, and our orders of 4 nigiri took a good 20+ minutes. When we finally got it, they had wasabi on all of them, which they never have done before. I hate wasabi and had to scrape it off. They should really think about expanding their HH menu or offering AYCE and make sure the chefs are consistent.

Used to be 4 stars now it went down over time. Sushi options are limited in this area. They used to do this beautiful fancy presentation of each sushi dish. It was unique and fun to look at the design. I always felt they were on the pricier side though.   The last couple times I went here that presentation no longer exists. The nigiri sushi was PAPER thin and mainly rice. I've never seen sushi cut so thin. Rip off.

Thank you to Christine, the manager and the staff of Hokkaido for making me such a wonderful lunch. I received a call from her letting me know she was aware of what happened and apologized and offered to comp me lunch today. I placed my order on the way there and she let me know the timeframe. I arrived and received my order shortly after. She was very nice and apologized again and my food is amazing!! She even called me after to check to make sure I was happy. Thank you Christine!!

Found a crawling mystery bug in my salad, not a tiny bug either, half a dime size I'd say. Waitress was embarrassed and shocked, but not shocked enough apparently, she still charged us for our drinks. Never going back again. Still get the shivers from that. I wanted to like the place and it doesn't seem dirty, it could have been a random incident. But again, not going to chance it.
This is my favorite sushi place! Food is fresh and the sushi chefs make beautiful food!
Coming here to eat atleast 2-3 times a week, great sushi and great service low prices compare to other places. Can actually get full with $30 for 2 persons.  Highly recommended

We are pretty much a regular here, at least the waiter knows us each time we go in. :) We enjoyed their unique sushi rolls and their presentation are top notch, I really don't care about the AYCE places because I look for the quality of the fish/sushi not by how much I can stuff down.   So, Hokaido Sushi is rank up there next to Naked Fish.   I give it 4 1/2 stars.

This place is awesome, I came in here yesterday to give it a try and all was great. The service was excellent with a friendly atmosphere. I had a little chat with the chef Rocky and he seems like a really cool guy. The waiter was helpful the whole time and was very attentive. I looked through the menu and made a few orders with one being recommended by the waiter, and I can't say enough of how satisfying the food was. Its now one of my favorite sushi restaurant to go to. Will be back again soon.
We go here at least once a month. A good selection of interesting sushi. Late night happy hour starts at 10pm. 1/2 price on 1/2 size sushi, but it's the beer prices that make happy hour worth it.

This is, by far, an awesome sushi restaurant! I love the food, I love the service! Eric, one of the sushi chefs, is a character. He is so nice and kept us entertained. Soo, another sushi chef, is also very nice and friendly. I can't wait to bring my family and freinds here. I really like the Dark Horse sushi. But every sushi Eric made for us was yummy!

1 st time here and last time here . We just left there and and we are upset , we ordered 2 rolls to start. The rolls on the menu say inside the roll is soft shell crab and on top is soft shell crab. With fish on top .  Well no soft shell crab in the rolls at all.  When I asked the chef about it he said it comes with the imitation crab . That's when I showed him the menu where it shows what's in the rolls.  He says , hold on and goes to talk to the other guy , which I 'm guessing he might be the owner... so he comes back gives me this story about how expensive soft shell crab is and that no sushi place will put soft shell crab inside the rolls which is not true.  We also ordered the something wrong roll which again they put imitation crab in as well.  I wouldn't go back if it was free.

I like this place a lot. The only reason I'm not giving it five stars is that it only has ONE vegetarian sushi roll. It's a delicious vegetable tempura roll, but I would appreciate a little more variety for the non-meat-eating crowd.   They do deliver, which is unusual for sushi places. The restaurant is never very busy, so take-out and eat-in orders are very speedy. Plus, the associates are very kind.

Love this place, it's about time I write a review because this is my third time here! it has happy hour everyday 2-5pm and 9pm-close. Ordered the miso soup and garlic edamame to start with, all delicious. Got Yellowtail sashimi, Alaskan roll, Paradise roll, Hawaiian roll, all on the happy hour menu, $8-$10 range for 8 pieces under the special rolls. For the classic roll we ordered Philadelphia roll $4.95. Among 4 of us this was plenty of food. We ended the meal with mochi, yummy! I'm going to be a regular here!

Pros: close to home, easy parking, food is excellent. Fried rice, gyoza, veg tempura and Cali roll were soooo good. Maybe best I've had on west side of town.  Cons:  service for takeout is slow. I placed an order online, 20 minutes. I got there in 20 minutes, waited 5 minutes for someone to greet me, paid/tipped, told to sit and wait. And wait. 30 minutes later I got my order. Place wasn't that busy just poor mgmnt. Other customers that left got a cheery thank you & goodbye. Me, nadda. They must not care about us lowly picker uppers tho my tab was &35.   Probably won't go back.

Good sushi, good service, cute decor and very conveniently located for me. Their rolls (dragon roll and dark horse) are tasty, the fish seems fresh but their hand rolls are pretty boring. I recently asked for a custom hand roll. It tasted great! Spicy tuna, Spicy crab, Avocado, Tempura shrimp, Rice or scallops w/soy paper.

This is my favorite place to get sushi, ever! It's extremely fresh, delicious and always pretty timely service. Good music and vibes. I come here at least once a week!! Special shout out to ELLIE  and Jenny for always giving the best service. I love hokaidos!!!

The food was great and very fresh.  They have an incredible selection of sushi.  The prices are very reasonable.  We ordered two types of sushi (Lobster Roll and Caterpillar) and a bowl of rice and it was delicious.  We sat at the bar and the guy that made the sushi and another worker were so friendly.  We can't wait to go back again.

Something wrong 69!  One of my favorite rolls at Hokaido.  I haven't eaten at the physical location recently, but we have had take out... & it's just as good.    It's pretty fresh for Las Vegas sushi.  Lots of rolls to choose from, sashimi, as well as the usual Japanese bento entree options: chicken/beef/salmon teriyaki, Katsu, taba shiyoyaki, etc..   Some of my favorites: Philly crunch,  the sweetheart roll, the Mexican roll, yellowtail and tuna sashimi, and of course something's wrong 69.   It is not all you can eat.  I remember that it used to be, but I guess that's changed.  There are lots of appetizers to choose from... but the garlic edamame & gyoza are my 1st choices.    They offer combos- a good one is 19.95 for two choice rolls + a rainbow roll.  Good for two ppl.      The spot itself is not a big place, but there's lots of seating with booths and counter seating where you can of course watch the sushi chefs do work.    The waitresses are helpful...sometimes.  I only say sometimes because most of the time it's a translation game.  They are very attentive and polite though.    All in all, a good sushi place in the local area.
Not a fan of the sashimi/sushi but the rolls here are good. I would recommend this place if you like to order rolls but try elsewhere if you are a sashimi/nigiri person
The freshest sushi in town. There isn't anything I've ever had here that I wouldn't recommend!
Oishi des!  Very fresh sushi & sashimi. The spicy ramen was extra spicy, as per request
My Fav Sushi spot in Summerlin! Try there chef specials or the chalkboard menu. Clean and fast

Made a 20 minute trek from the Las Vegas Strip with my GF b/c of the Yelp review.  What a terrible mistake! I wish I can give this place a 0 star, but... We sat at the bar.  Place was less than 1/3 full.  It took about 50 minutes to get:  Amaebi; Salmon Martini; agadashi tofu; a bowl of steam rice (last 2 from kitchen), the rest of the order; Ikura; Hokaido Roll, Miso soup, etc.. was completely forgotten by the sushi guy and waitress... the food was mediocro at MOST!  I felt so BAD that I took my GF when we came up from So. Cal.  This is the abosolute WORST experience we both had.  In fact, we went back to our hotel room and I had to make instant noodle to round out my dinner!  This place SHOULD NOT be in business.  It's the MOST horrible experience, EVER!  For those of you that gave this dump more than 2 stars:  SHAME ON YOU for misleading people that rely on Yelp.  That is unless, you are used to eating dirt and scrubs in the desert of LV and honestly don't know any better!  For everyone else:  STAY AWAY!  you are better off... Well, with instant noodle with a bit of hot sauce.

I've eaten at several dozens of sushi restaurants in Las Vegas over the years ranging from affordable AYCE to super expensive and traditional... this was one of the best all around sushi dining experiences I've had ever:  - Quality fish - Excellent presentation - Reasonable prices - Nice selection of rolls - Clean environment - Friendly staff.  When you have a 5 star experience why go anywhere else?
Good sushi, great service, huge menu.  We will definitely be back.  Hope the beer is colder next time.

We are regulars for over 3 years, once a week we would come here and eat sushi. The service has declined a lot. We were just there a couple weeks ago and we had terrible service. We were the only people there, they had two waitresses and one sushi chef. Took forever to get refills and our check. I had to seek out the waitress to get our check, only to find her chit chatting with a fellow co-worker. I waited a bit before I had to stop her mid-sentence to ask for our check.  Plus side, the sushi is fantastic, delicious and fresh. The staff are friendly and the waitress is nice, she remembered us every time we came in.  Deal breaker-Service! You can only deal so much with bad service. Especially, when we were the only people in the restaurant, there is no reason for such terrible service. We have given this place multiple chances hoping the service would change.

Every time I come here, I love it. The sushi rolls are good and they have cool pretentious names like "what the hell" and "who's your daddy" (I'm not gonna order a roll that's named "Jonathan" unless it's named after Jonathan Ogden). They also have a happy hour (cheap sushi, I'm in). Bento boxes for lunch are nice too. The only problem is they don't have all you can eat, but the prices are still reasonable, so I don't leave feeling like a fat whore.
This is a fantastic sushi place... every meal is served to perfection... each meal a work of art... LOVE it.
Great place, typical sushi joint. They are fresh and very hospitable. Prices are ok as well. Come here if you are near by but don't go across town for it.

I went here last night with a local friend who also hadn't been before and found everything except one dish to be fantastic. I'll start with the outlier: the mango salmon roll tasted fine, but was bland. There, with that out of the way, on to the awesome. We were going to order fried tofu originally, but the helpful chaps behind the sushi bar steered us towards the house made tofu, which was delicious and had a nice consistency. After that arrived our sushi. Eel and yellowtail nigiri were both fresh and flavorful. The ultimate tuna roll, served over a light sauce, was decadent, and definitely the best dish of the night. The "monkey brain" my friend ordered, which thankfully was nothing like the images from an Indiana Jones movie that I conjured, was also terrific. We opted for some vanilla and strawberry mochi ice cream for dessert. My friend's sadness at them being out of vanilla turned to joy after we tried the chocolate peanut butter instead, which tasted a lot like a Reese's cup. Overall a really nice place with friendly staff and excellent food, and being located in a quieter neighborhood on the southwest side of the city is a nice respite from the bustle of the strip.

This was my first time trying sushi because I've always been convinced that I hate seafood.  However, I decided to give it a go because I have been warming up to shrimp and crab recently.  My fear about sushi is that it will be "fishy" in taste.  The fish here was so fresh that it practically melted in my mouth and tasted better than I expected!  The chef was not super talkative or anything (we sat at the sushi bar), which was fine by me.  Try the Something Wrong #69... delicious!
The best sushi Restaurant in town. Service is excellent and fast.

The Skinny: oxidized, fishy albacore tuna, dry tonkatsu and hard veggie tempura (2) Service: was okay - only problem was the ambience was poor due to a rather loud table across the room (3), value: around $17 for the bento box which isn't bad but given the quality will not likely return.(2)  Not sure what to order, our table decided to order 3 bento boxes to have some variety. On the list of things we tried: grilled saba, california roll, albacore tuna sashimi, tonkatsu, tuna sashimi, salmon sashimi, and veggie tempura. Each bento came with salad, rice and miso soup.  The sides of miso soup, salad, california roll were all okay - nothing special. The grilled saba was good.  The albacore sashimi was pretty bad. There were 5 thinly sliced, grey, mushy, watery pieces of fish with a very strong fishy odour. Certainly not good quality. The salmon sashimi was not cut in the proper manner and appeared like rectangular blocks. The tuna sashimi was okay.   My husband's tonkatsu was poor. Pounded too thin and likely using meat that doesn't have enough fat content, it caused the end product to be too dry and hard.   The veggie tempura was difficult to eat, greasy and unpleasantly hard.  I'm not sure if it was how we ordered or what we ordered but I didn't enjoy the food very much here. If you do decide to go, I think you should try ordering a la carte instead. Either way, this place gets a two star review.

I was craving some sushi rolls nothing exotic just some solid yummy rolled sushi. I yelped and saw this place had some good reviews. My husband and I walked in around 730 Monday evening there were a few people sitting at the sushi bar and only one server. We ordered screaming orgasm I usually don't like this dish it's my husbands fav but theirs was really really good my husband fend kept the sauce afterwards to dip everything in haha. Paradise roll was great, yellowtail maki was not that great I didn't like how the yellowtail was chopped up to the point it was mushy. Salmon skin roll was crispy and great!!! This place reminds me of I love sushi in Henderson Korean owned and very good!!!! Since it's so close to the house we will def be back soon!
not as good as it used to be. quality of the fish has downgraded a tad if you are looking for straight sashimi. but if you are looking for delicious rolls, this totally is the place to go!
My Son and I LOVE THIS PLACE!!  Rocky even makes me a special vegetarian roll :))   AWESOME!!!
Great happy hour, dishes are good and prices are very reasonable.  Definitely recommend this place, service at he bar is great, chefs are very attentive and provide help in case you need it.
3stars all for food only. No service......If you looking for good food but dont care bad service, then it is still worth.

In my opinion, this is one of the best places to get fresh fish in Vegas. Their sashimi is amazing and the sushi chefs go above and beyond their calling - always making efforts to get unique types of fish and ensuring that whatever they have is of the best quality.   This is not an AYCE sushi joint and that is part of the reason I like it so much. At many AYCE places, the sushi becomes less special. The chefs often don't spend as much time on the rolls or don't put a whole lot of fish in the rolls.   These guys make AMAZING rolls. The flavors are always different from what you will find at most sushi places in Vegas. Something about this place just makes me feel happy and comfortable and not rushed or bombarded with 900 different options for sushi. The wait staff is friendly and efficient. The sushi chefs are so talented and also extremely entertaining.   Give this place a shot. You may spend more than you would at an AYCE restaurant, but it is worth it in freshness and flavor!

Aside from their great sushi rolls and chef's nigiri choices they have great Poke bowls and ramen noodles.  My favorite is their spicy seafood ramen which is not too spicy but has a very flavorful broth.  The Poke bowls are served with a large portion of fish and choice of greens or rice.  The service at times may be a little slow but for me the food is worth the wait.  Plus the wait staff is so nice and polite.  Check this stop out and enjoy.

The food here is always delicious.  The wait staff greets you when you walk in and are very accommodating.  They are not quick at bringing your check so if you are there on a lunch break make sure you ask for it early.   Be weary when they charge you. The lady added an extra 7 to the end which made her charge me 107.77 in stead if 10.77. Yes she voided it, but it took 4 days with the weekend and all. So be careful.
All around this place is awesome.  They have a fantastic staff, and the food is always presented in an amazing way.  Not to mention I have not had one thing here that was not good.
BEST HAPPY HOUR EVER!! Starts at 9 and has the cheapest but tastiest rolls ever. The service is fast and the servers are so polite. We drive across town just to eat at this happy hour
This sushi joint is SOOOOO good that they never lost business during the economic crunch. That says something.

Best sushi spot in vegas by FAR!!! Eric, Soo, and JJ are amazing chefs and make everything like a piece of art. Its the type of place you go and people are taking pictures of the plates.  You walk in and are greeted by Eric yelling HAAAASHHHAAAI from behind the bar.  The rolls are all amazing and fresh, but the best thing to do is just sit at the bar and leave your ordering in the hands of Eric, and JJ.  Just let them make something and you will not leave anything short of satisfied.  Make sure you order a sake bomb with Eric, and watch him smash it for you, its worth the price alone.

We had a craving for sushi and decided to try Hokaido for the first time. They looked fantastic. I gave 3 stars because they didn't have the right taste. I think it was their cream cheese...only Philadelphia Cream Cheese is acceptable! Seriously though they were good, but change the cream cheese and add some more cucumber and they could be GREAT!

Love their happy hour specials!   Their special fish of the day is always good. Shima Aji is great.   They have my favorite age dashi tofu as well.  Light and crisp coating with delicious broth.  Generous portions.

This is a typical/average sushi spot for Vegas..nothing special enough to require your attention or motivate you make it out here specifically, but the casual sushi eater (California Roll, Philadelphia Roll, Spicy Tuna, etc.) will have no problem enjoying themselves here.  On the plus side the sushi chefs here are personable and fun.

I need to write a review to this place, not for the food, which was perfectly fine, but because of the sushi chef. I am in love with the friendliness he showed and how willing he is for appealing to different tastes. We came in late at night looking for a place we could have some soup and a couple of drinks. I was not disappointed. Yes we didn't end up getting soup, but instead I was able to convince my boyfriend that sushi is delicious. The sushi chef helped us by recommending kind of like a surf and turf sushi which was delicious. Then he made a spicy jalape√±o roll for my boyfriend which was a bit too spicy for me, but he made it up by suggesting his take on what I am used to calling a crunchy roll. Overall I had a lot of fun and the food was yummy. The prices are a bit pricy but it is worth it. My advise would be sit at the bar. Way better atmosphere and you get to interact with the chef!

Decadent Sushi Rolls, Fresh Fish & Soju  HUGE rolls, decorated for a Yelp King/Queen.  When you're looking for beautiful sushi this is definitely a place that comes to mind.  On the menu or off of the menu Eric is a sushi artist who knows how to make your taste-buds dance.    The restaurant isn't as cozy as some of the other Las Vegas Sushi Spots, but the food more than makes up for any lack of ambiance.  Go for a hike, check out the mountains, and come here to rest your feet and fill your tummy.   Date Rating: 6 Pick up Scale: 1  Strong Suggestion: Sit at the sushi bar and hang out with Eric. There may only be a handful of reviews for this spot but I've been a California/NYC sushi snob for years - you will not be disappointed.

The BEST sushi in town!! We have been here once and I totally forgot to write a review about how amazing the place is.. But we are here now and again the service and food is amazing!! Our favorite here are the caterpillar roll, the sweetheart roll and the Japanese lasagna roll. Our waitress also remembered what we ordered last time after only being here once.. What a nice feeling!!

Verdict: Good happy hour, great food and as of this writing; their service game has stepped up--which earns them a solid 4-star rating in my book!  If you're looking for a quiet spot to grab some good sushi and don't mind waiting from time to time for your food, then this is your joint!   They used to be much slower at bringing out food even when they had 2 chefs on deck, two servers and no one else to serve but you and your boo in the room--kinda sad. But now, that's a thing of the past and since we've been back, they've upped their service game and I can appreciate their newfound hustle.   Quick tip: Order a spicy scallop hand roll or two and thank me later for your new favorite sushi go-to order.

Food was delicious. Service was great. Very attentive. The chef that was cooking for us was pretty funny. The food came quicker than I anticipated which was a plus. The best part is that they are located right by my house. I will be returning.
The wife and I come here all the time and the food is always great and the service is spectacular!!!!

I discovered this place a few months ago and I'm here about once a week. I actually just checked my credit cards and I've been here 25 times since July. I I haven't once had a bad experience here. I always sit at the bar and it's usually during happy hour after 9pm where it stays happy hour until closing (1am). Rocky and Sam are awesome and it seems they're here most of the time. There are a ton of regulars here as I noticed most people are on a first name basis with them. Everyone is constantly feeding them beer or sake. It's amazing they still have all their fingers intact with those super sharp knives :)  This is my favorite sushi place in LV anywhere remotely in this price range. The quality is superior to any of the AYCE places I've been to and I still walk out under 40 bucks on average with tip and I can eat.  Some of my favorites here: The garlic edamame appetizer is awesome...and SUPER garlicky if you're down with that. Monica roll (lobster, shrimp, tuna, avocado on soy topped in crispy onion) Dark Horse if you like crab Hawaiian if you like tuna Zion Canyon if you liked baked rolls Cajun albacore sashimi Live scallop (when they have it)
I always try something new when I go here and I am never let down. The spicy garlic edamame is delicious. Gyoza's are great, we ordered a second one they were that good. Love this place!

Love this place!  Chef Eric and Chef JJ are awesome.  They may not have AYCE, but they still get my business.  Their rolls are so delicious!  I get the Heart Scream, Dark Horse and 300 Rolls.  Chef Eric also makes a special Tuna hand roll.  The sashimi is good to.  They give you your money's worth.  It's not sliced paper thin like at some other places.  This is my go-to place when I want sushi.

I was around this area looking for a sushi fix when I yelped and saw all the great reviews for this place. The reviews are pretty much on the dot too.  Hokaido has the kind of quality food and fish from a higher-class sushi restaurant--the kind that usually reside on the strip--but have hole-in-the-wall sushi joint prices.  Their list of rolls is pretty impressive and affordable, and the actual entrees are decent too. My cousin and I shared a shrimp tempura roll along with our bento boxes ($7.95 for a kids bento box is a steal by the way) which actually came with a lot of food. I chose the two-item bento box for $11.95 and had some of the best vegetable tempura I've ever had in a Las Vegas sushi place. I'm a big fan of tempura and tend to order it whenever I try a new sushi place and this tempura batter was top-notch.  Much lighter, crispier, and done well but not too well done. No soggy spots and it wasn't dripping in oil either. Pretty much just yum-tastic.   The spicy tuna roll that came with my bento was okay, I've had far better spicy tuna at Sushi Wa, but this wasn't far off the mark. I think the tuna may have been a little on the ripe side, but it wasn't anything I couldn't handle. I've noticed that Las Vegas sushi places rarely have the kind of fresh fish I've had at coastal sushi restaurants, which is obvious since we live in a desert. But the spicy factor wasn't too overbearing, which I appreciated since I've been to way too many sushi joints where they over flavor the fish to the point where you can't even tell what kind of fish you're having.   Overall it was a really great place with really great prices. I hope to return soon to try more of their creative sushi concotions.

The place is really nice.  Beautiful and clean.    The service was ok.  The problem is that the communication between the server and us wasn't so good.  We asked few times to not put shrimps in the rolls and we got two rolls with shrimps.   Also prices are a little high.

With moving to the other side of town, it was nice to find a new sushi spot near by. Service and rolls are great. Plus, they have a great happy hour that has options of 4-8 pieces. It gives you the option to try a lot of different rolls. All in all, it's a nice little spot and I've loved everything I've tried. Nice place as my last one was I Love Sushi.

In the mood for Sushi...tired of the same spot, tried something new and I'm glad I did. Thanks to my fellow YelperZ I tried out Hokaido. I ordered the Dark Horse roll. It looked like this roll was made with love...like the chef knew me personally. Soft...a little crunch...and was available in brown rice which I love. I will be checking in again...most likely tomorrow...cuz I'm fat. Lol

Left an all day meeting, getting ready to go to the airport and was craving sushi so I did a Yelp search.  This restaurant was about a mile from my office. It was nice to find a sushi restaurant that is still open at 2 PM. Sushi restaurants are usually closed between 2-5 pm. I ordered two specialty rolls and a sea urchin sushi. The specialty rolls were good at about $12 each so it's average. The sea urchin was very expensive, $10 for two pieces.  The waitress told me it was "special" that it was flown in from Japan. However, it tasted just like the normal Sea urchin sushi I would get in any sushi place.  I will definitely go there again but not order the "special" sea urchin.

Excellent Sushi.  Specifically the rolls were tasty and menu made it easy to pick rolls that were out of the ordinary.  Typically you read the description and cross your fingers but here you not only have a great description but a picture as well.  Service was good and very friendly.  We will be back for sure!!
Met up with the family, pretty big group. They took care of us right away. Prices are very reasonable, place is very clean!
We come here every time we are in Vegas and they never disappoint. Best udon I've ever had.. And the dark horse roll is superb! Service is also always on point.

I absolutely LOVE this place!  You can not go wrong with seafood in LV.  Because of their high demand, it is always fresh no matter where you go.  This place happens to be my favorite spot for 5yrs now.    My favorite sushi roll is The Red Mountain, ask for it with Jalapenos.  ;)  Enjoy, bitches!
The Ebi Crunch was good, but I think I fell in love with the Sweet Heart.  It was fresh and sweet with the hint of grilled flavor.

I got take out from this place because it was close to the rental that I was staying at. I ordered the seaweed salad, the vega-tempura roll, and a cucumber roll. There was a miscommunication with the order, which was totally my fault because she read it back to me on the phone and I wasn't paying attention. When I got there and realized my order was wrong, they were so nice and replaced it immediately! When I got home and ate my food it was amazing! So fresh and delicious. One of the best veggie rolls i've had in a while!

I killed an ant on the counter after I got my check for my food.. I'll never go back I threw up after.. They served the most skimp ass salmon nigiri and salmon hand roll that I have ever seen. Really nice people just horrible food and I killed a big on their sushi bar.. I WILL NEVER GO BACK  if I could give 0 stars I would

I was so disappointed after trying this restaurant. Their food is nothing special besides the tacky artificial flower decoration on every sushi roll we ordered. I am so turned off by the artificial flower decoration because I don't want to think about them reusing it time after time.   The price is okay, but not great for what you get. We ordered a yellowtail collar, yellowtail carpaccio, touchdown roll, JJ's, and some other rolls. Yellowtail collar tasted the best, but the rest are bland or not memorable at all.  Even though the staff was nice and service was good, I probably won't go back again.
This was our first time there and we loved it!!! The sushi was great as well as the presentation! I wish they had all you can eat but that won't keep me away, everything was too good!

I usually love this place every time I come here it's always good service good food. The service I got today was horrible! We ordered a teriyaki box for my son that's the first thing we ordered then we ordered from the happy hour menu maybe 5 rolls.  When she served our sushi we had no chop sticks so we asked if we could have some chop sticks. She comes back with one and we asked her if we could have another one because hello there's the two of us.  So we waited about 10-15 minutes and wondered when she was going to bring my sons teriyaki box because he was already getting fussy because he's hungry and we already finished one roll of our sushi. When it seemed like we waited another 10 minutes I got up and asked her about the teriyaki box and she gave me a blank stare like she didn't know what I was talking about so she says "ok I'll put it in". That pissed me off that was the first thing we ordered and she forgot to put it in. I told her never mind if you forgot but she kept repeating almost done. So after waiting another 10 minutes and btw we're already done with our sushi and my son didn't even had his food yet. We told the server we didn't want the chicken anymore and wanted our check so we could leave but here she comes with the chicken. It didn't look appetizing the chicken was burnt like they rush it. My son didn't want to eat cause it was hard and burnt. We paid and left. Won't be coming back here again.

Love this place you have many options to choose from other than sushi! You can order other entrees and the prices are reasonable I love thier happy hr menu! Will recommend my friends and family to come here!

A small, traditional and cozy sushi spot located on Ft. Apache. I've been to many sushi places all over Las Vegas and Henderson. So I guess it would be safe to say that the quality and taste of the sushi here is one of the best in the Las Vegas Area. The food menu prices are decent. The service is great. The staff here is nice and polite, they do not rush you like some other places. There is not much that I can think of to really complain about. A 5 star rating is well deserved.

Fresh fish, great service, nice menu.  I love eating here.  I love the fact that you can tell Eddie or JJ to make whatever they want to and everything that comes out is awesome.  I do it omakase style for most things here.  I can't explain it any more than this:  YUM-O.

If you love sushi, this place is heaven! I am so glad I came across Hokaido because it is now my go-to sushi joint. I love the sushi chefs!!! They are AMAZING, I haven't even ordered off the menu the last couple times I have been there, I just let them make a one of a kind specialty roll and I have never been disappointed!   The sushi here is always good! The service is also very good. If you wanna impress someone take them here, the presentation of the sushi is phenomenal!!

Order thru post mates (deilivery service) and the sushi had bone in it and it's not suppose to have any bone. They need to prepare it better especially if it's going out for delivery. But then again I was the lazy one who didn't want to drive to their establishment...
This is one of the best sushi places I have found in Vegas. The staff is attentive and sweet. The food and service deserves 5 stars for sure!

Tried this restaurant based on Yelp reviews. Decent atmosphere and service. Ordered typical food because family doesn't like to explore.   Seaweed salad, good flavor and portion.  Steamed Gyoza 5-6 on the plate. Very yummy according to my daughter.  She offered but we declined because she loves them.  Wifey ordered chicken katsu. Nice and crisp, not greasy and a good portion too!.   I ordered chicken teriyaki lightly charbroiled and flavored. Good sauce.   We also ordered caterpillar, crispy california and tekka maki rolls (oink!). I know, I know a lot of food for a family of three.  Forgot to mention, entrees came with miso soup and salad. Overall pretty good value and pretty authentic.  Try it, you'll like it!

We LOVE Hokaido sushi.  The sushi here is so fresh.  The service is fantastic!  We always order off of the special board, and it does not disappoint.  They have a large roll menu, if that's your thing.  Our current favorite appetizer is the steak tataki.  My favorite sushi is the Kanpachi.  It's like butter. Whenever we ask our 6 year old what he wants for dinner, it's always sushi, at Hokaido!

This place has really good sushi and ramen I recommend to everyone , I had there ramen pork pho and it was delicious,  my sister had the dragon roll and it came in a big portion size and was very good

Amazing rolls. Super authentic. Welcoming environment. Priced Right. There's something for everybody; also, the bar serves as a community gathering space. Nothing but good vibes. I'm never disappointed.

so far this is my favorite regular sushi place. regular as in i may go once a week. it's not expensive, it's normal priced. fresh sushi.  i've been craving okimo, and each time i've gone, they didn't have it. oh well, not going to dock them a star on that.

It may have changed ownership but this place turned from decent to terrible. My family and I go or take out at least 3x per month. We will not be going back. This past week I took out, and had to wait long after order was said to be ready.The rug was really dirty at the entrance and clearly had not been vacuumed for days. They wouldn't take my coupon because she said no manager was there to "ok" it. Got the food home and there was zero presentation. The ginger was all dried out, and the rolls were about 1/3 smaller than they had been in the past and smelled fishy.We ordered out usual appetizer and received something else. I called and they said I needed to bring the appetizer back to get credit. I did so the next day and he said they had closed out the night, so I have to wait to get it credited back to my card. No apology , nothing but rude and unconcerned.

530 on a Friday night, we walked in and waited for them to make a space at the sushi bar as it was covered with dirty dishes and it was filthy. The waitress had an attitude, walked up basically shoved all the dirty crap from one side to the other to make a space in the middle so we would be flanked by dirty piled up dishes. It was unsanitary, it was gross, and the waitress had a major attitude. And there was nobody in the restaurant, it was basically empty. If they can't keep up with their business in an empty restaurant what happens when it's full The last time we went the service was also poor, and added unsanitary conditions, we will not return
I wanted to update my review to let you know that the sushi is amazing my frustration  was with the two sushi chefs.  I have eaten sushi here for years.  Maybe they were just having a rough night
Absolutely LOVE this place, this is the ONLY sushi place I eat at...Fish is always fresh, reasonable prices good service

Amazing and authentic ambiance. Friendly staff and the rolls were delicious and fresh. Made with extreme care and pride right in front of you. The wasabi was a little thin and weak for me but to my family it seemed just right. We will be back.

We came here probably 3 or 4 months ago and the bar was packed. The tables though were probably 1/4 occupied and the server told us that there was a 30-minute wait. In the end, since my bf was too hungry, we just left and went somewhere else.   Yesterday was a different story. When we came in on a Saturday night, we were surprised that only 1 table was occupied. My bf was seated right away and I came in 10 minutes after.   We tried the following: oyster shooters, hamachi kama, Bikini Roll, Red Rock Roll and Kiss my Ass Roll. We also tried some nigiris... Cajun Albacore, Hamachi, Super White Tuna and Maguro Tuna. The nigiris were good but not the best I've tasted. The Bikini and Red Rock rolls were delicious. Those two rolls were different. A must try when you visit Hokkaido. However, the Kiss my Ass was a disappointment. We did not like the gravy sauce that was drizzled on top of it. The hamachi Kama was decent size for the price and pretty good too.  The service was good. The server was very attentive on refilling our drinks and giving me pickled ginger. Though I am not sure if I can say this if the restaurant was half full.

CUTE LITTLE PLACE   The interior of the place is cute & small w/ a couple of tables & a sushi bar top to seat maybe 8 people at most. There were specials signs above the sushi bar & colorful lanterns above.   They have HH everyday 2pm - 5pm & RHH 9pm - close which is always a plus for me if I just wanna drive down the street to get a quick bite of something.   FANNY BAY OYSTER $2.50 - uhhh.... I was a bit disappointed w/ this one... IMHO I feel like the oyster was old or it was FANNY bay oysters... it had the distinct flavor that usually makes me dislike oysters that my parents usually love... & I have had FANNY bay before & I love them. =\   PREMIUM UNI SUSHI $14.50 - this was DERICIOUS! plus they give you a pretty large amount... but definitely a bit more pricey than other places we went to recently.  HH 8 PIECE CALI ROLL $3.50 - I was craving a California roll from the last time I ate sushi at NAKED sushi since they made it with crab stick instead if the blended crab & Mayo. I scarffed this roll down ahahahha  HH 4 PIECE AVO ROLL $1.95 - so cheap & can't go wrong w/ avocado rolls.   HH DBL SALMON ROLL $8.50 - so I will assume this was good.... because my other half scarffed it down before I could turn around to take a picture....  HH SALMON SUSHI $3.25 - the chef gave us the salmon belly part & it just melted right on your tongue.  I will definitely be back to try more stuff since we came here RIGHT AFTER we ate lunch next door... fat kid issues... ahahhahaha

Hokaido Sushi has been around for years now.  I used to eat at their place pretty regularly and their food was awesome, but for reasons of eating healthy, I cut them out for a while... well their is brown rice now!  My wife finally got me to come here again and I was pleasantly surprised.  First of all, their lunch specials have improved.  The Lunch Box Special is 8.95 and your choice of meat (steak you add $1.00).   Brown rice is another substitute that you can get at another $1.00.  That brings lunch to over $10.00 per person, but the quality is very good and worth it!
