I ordered the Lunch Box Special with Chicken and Beef and brown rice, my wife ordered the Lunch Box Special with double beef.  Both meals came with Miso Soup as an appetizer.  It included a nice salad, 4 pieces of California roll sushi, rice and your choice of meets.  We also ordered the Tuna Poki (Poke) which was very delicious and came with seaweed salad as well.    Very delicious.  The waitress was super nice.  The food came surprisingly fast!  She did forget to put in our brown rice order, but that was quickly remedied.  I guess I'll be putting this back in to my work lunch rotation for sure!

This is my favorite sushi spot in all of Vegas...and we have some great sushi establishments!!!!  Everything is amazing and fresh. It's hard not to give almost all sushi places in Vegas 5 stars, however, this one stands out from the pack! A truly must go
Great atmosphere and the happy hour gives you delicious rolls at an amazing price. If your near this spot it is a must stop spot. Plus the roll names are funny.

I love this place! Fresh fish!!! And amazing rolls. Try the seared salmon sushi!!! And JJ is a great sushi chef. He works Thursdays-Monday's =) the service is great as well. Didn't have to wait long for my food or drinks.
This place is by far the best sushi house in Vegas!    Every time my girl and I come here they take really good care of us and the food is amazing!!  Never had a bad experience coming here.

I really like this place. It's a little on the small side but it was quiet and cute. Luckily we came in around 4 PM and they have happy hour every day from 3 to 5 PM and then some other time I don't remember. There are rolls are fairly cheap and you can do half rolls instead of full rolls if you'd like.   The sushi came out on a cute boat and was beautifully decorated. Everything tasted fresh and was really good so there are no complaints here.  I think I will make this my new go to sushi joint if I'm just eating by my house.

I've been to a lot of sushi restaurants all over the U.S. and this one stands out as one of the best. Went here with some friends and we pretty much had the place to ourselves on a Friday night, I don't understand how, because this place should be jamming all the time in Vegas. Excellent service and wonderfully scrumptious sushi! I'd highly recommend checking this place out while in town. Totally worth the drive.

Well I got a job yesterday (yay!)  and we wanted to celebrate (yay!) and stay close to home, so we went to another place that will not be named because I am going to give them another chance.  We waited 20 minutes without being acknowledged or even given water.  So for the first time in my life I walked out, the manager chased after us and offered 50 percent off our whole meal if we came back.  We told him we'd come back another time, and we will.  However I had to tell this story to preface what an odd night this was.  Things didn't start off well at Hokaido, the host yelled at us in an extremely loud voice when we first got in and then our waitress rushed us on drink and appetizer orders before we had a chance to breathe(you can see how this night was starting off weird for us).  We were ready to order drinks and did, then we felt rushed to order something else so we ordered Miso soups.  The soups were great, she then gave us more time to figure out what to order.  We ordered quite a bit of food and for the most part it was really good.    The boy ordered a bento box with salmon sashimi and chicken katsu.  He received tuna sashimi.  Tuna is good and he liked it but it's kind of odd.  I ordered hamachi sashimi, 2 rolls and what is basically their take on jalapeno poppers.  We then asked if they had fresh wasabi, she said they did but they would have to charge us.    -My hamachi sashimi was very poorly cut, the blood line was left on it and it was a rather thick slab.  I'm used to hamachi tasting like butter but this was so big and bulky and the blood line made it taste a little off. -My rolls were nice, I had the double hamachi which was just ok and the Mexican roll which was very good.   -The Jalapeno "poppers" were probably my favorite.  They are stuffed with spicy tuna and cream cheese, tempura battered and fried with a nice sweet sauce.  They aren't super cooked, they are kind of crunchy still and very yummy.  I recommend this for sure.  The big issue was with their "fresh wasabi" that they charged us $2 for.  IT WASNT FRESH WASABI!  It looked like grated jalapenos or seranos with maybe some wasabi powder in it.  It was wet and had seeds in it, not what fresh wasabi looks like.  If you don't have something, tell us, don't pretend you have it.  This is very bad and makes me not want to go back there again even though it is close and the rest of the meal was ok.  I need to process my feelings about the meal before I decide if I can go there again.

I have two Favourite restaurants, one Thai one Japanese....This without a doubt trumps every other sushi or japanese and quite possibly Asian restaurant I've ever been too.   Up until 5 months ago I had never tried sushi before and this was my virgin experience...and I was hooked instantly. I have since tried sushi in many other restaurants and while they are ok none of them have even a patch on Hokaido.  The staff are all very friendly and funny and like to engage with their customers, unlike a lot of restaurants. They are VERY child friendly, and I often take my youngest sister who is 3 and always requests to go here.   They have so many delicious rolls, the top favourites of mine are the Muchi Muchi, the Red Mountain & the Tiger roll, but that said each one of their rolls are amazing and I've never not liked a roll.   The Chicken Katsu is also to die for along with their Dynamite, Tempura Shrimp & Veg, and their Teriyaki Salmon.  Yes it is pricy but you get what you pay for, quality produce, incredible dishes and outstanding presentation. It is also about 15 mins drive from the strip, but well worth the trip. A lot of my friends come from out of town and the first thing they always request...HOKAIDO  Believe me once you try Hokaido, you'll never go back to those all you can eat run of the mill sushi places.  This is one of those places that are an amazing finds, that never fail to impress.

Gave them another shot for lunch and my experience was much improved. First, the server was so friendly, she was the perfect host from seating to leaving. Just great!  Ordered the $14.95 lunch special which includes 6 pieces of nigiri, a basic roll of your choice (cali, cucumber, or spicy tuna) and a soup & salad, and then separately a small sake on the side not part of the lunch deal . The only bad part of the meal was sake, it had a little funk to it, like maybe it was really low end. Salad was the standard gingery-sweet & spicy dressing but refreshing and good.   What impressed me was the quality of their nigiri. Also, this was one of the better spicy tuna rolls I have had in a long time between the freshness of the fish and the taste of their mix. It was SPICY, like I like it- sometimes I find these rolls to be bland. Not here! Also, check out my photo of the nigiri- whoa, you can just see the glisten freshness. Definitely glad I gave it another try, will be back!!
Awesome food! Awesome service! JJ the chef is why we come back. He's amazing!sit at the sushi bar and enjoy your fresh fish and shots.

The sushi and nigiri was so darn fresh here and reasonably priced. Not to mention the friendly service from chef Su. Atmosphere was lively even diring lunch hour....Definitely satisfied my craving and will most certainly be going back.

Poor customer service. I went there with four of my girlfriends and we each ordered four rolls. She mixed all of our rolls up on different plates so we had to figure out which was ours, grab our food from friends' plates, & figure out what else was missing. I asked her to please put our food separate from each others to ease the confusion and she said she did it to minimize out wait time so we could all eat together. Then we were missing rolls and she kept forgetting our food. Toward the end of our meal, we had our missing food but one friend noted and informed our server that she didnt get her "What The Hell" roll. We had two orders of that, one for her and one for my other friend. She never got hers but our server insisted she remembered bringing it out to us. We only got ONE of them. We were supposed to have TWO. So she said she would remove it from the receipt, again saying she remembered giving it. She gave us back the new receipt and again asked if we were sure we didn't get it, and again we said no. She gave us the updated receipt and left.   Aside from that, there happy hour menu was limited & quite boring.  Never coming back here again.

Service was horrible!!!! When greeted, the hostess & waitress were chatting then offered to sit us....then instead of our waitress offering us what to drink she went back to the hostess at front to finish their conversation......as I waited about 5-7 minutes for her attention and service...i finally decided to waive at her and told her we are ready to order...she finally took our order and didnt apologize....i was so disappointed....the food order took forever to come and she never once acknowledged if we need or if everything is ok with our order!!!! Never coming back again!!!!

This is my first time trying this place. Now they do have happy hour specials which makes it a great place to go and get sushi at a decent price, the service her e is really good they are very prompt in helping you out and the food is pretty good, I  will be returning again.
I love the bubble glass,music and sever.I can come here everyday.Atmosphere are great.I alway order Dynamite,shrimp tempura roll and hibachi fried rice.

I like this place because of their happy hour and staff. The sushi isn't awesome, but it isn't bad. Their service is always great and they are very quick. I like their happy hour menu because they have a variety of things besides sushi. Plus, if you want a quick, cheap bite late night, this place never disappoints. They even have the option of half rolls on happy hour, so for the people that aren't committed, that is always an amazing option! This also gives you the chance to try variety of things, as well. They have appetizers, sides, sushi, drinks etc. all on happy hour, so there will always be something for someone.

Some friends and I on vacation in Las Vegas decided on a sushi lunch!  The first two places we tried were closed on Sunday afternoon, but Hokaido Sushi was open and amazing!  The fish was excellent, the presentation was excellent, and some of the selections were quite novel.  Five stars!

Went here just at the end of Happy Hour.  The place looked clean with a dim decorated feel.  The service was okay, but should have been better with the fact that we were the only customers there.  The service & vibe from the staff could use some improvements. The food is what sold us.  The menu offers smaller size select rolls so you can use your money wisely to try a variety of rolls.  Unlike many other sushi restaurants, this place offers a select few of Nigiri sushi for Happy Hour prices as well.  The food is fresh & good quality with a good fish to rice ratio which is a huge pet peeve for this sushi addict.  We will be returning for more.

Love love love Hokkaido. They are right down the street from my house which is just an added bonus as I would drive across town to eat here.  We have eaten here quite a few times now and have loved everything I have tried.  Servers and chefs greet you when you come in and take great care of you and are super helpful with any questions or special requests.

This place is pretty good.For some reason, I've had a hard time finding good sushi here in Vegas. I like their seafood fried rice. I expected it to be hot, and it wasn't so I was a bit put off at first, but MAN, it's tasty! I ordered the small lunch bento box which comes with rice, 4 piece Cali roll, miso and salad. For some reason, they gave me 2 Cali rolls' and no rice. I asked for the rice as I wanted it and they seemed a bit annoyed. I said it says on menu it comes with rice. But, to be honest, when it comes to "asian" places, they are never very accommodating. Oh well, the food is good. Service is eh. Nothing good, nothing really bad either. Prices are pretty decent too.

I've had Hokaido bookmarked since I saw Megan C.'s review a few months back. With all their 5 star reviews I was eager to try it but a little weary of the hype. Sure, it might be a little premature for me give this place such high marks after one visit and after only trying two rolls, but those 2 rolls were damn good.   - Kamikaze roll ($11.00) - eel tempura roll with spicy tuna and avocado. Absolutely loved it! - Rock 'n Roll ($12.50) - 5 kinds of  generously cut  fresh fish and crab wrapped in cucumber.  Their menu is filled with all the prerequisite creatively-named rolls that contemporary sushi joints have but from what I saw of other rolls being served they are beautifully presented and quite large.  The staff and sushi chefs were incredibly friendly and treated everyone like they were old friends. The atmosphere isn't as modern as the rolls they serve, but it's still a comfortable environment. It's kinda got a stereotypical japanese restaurant feel with the dark wood and traditional japanese decor.  This place is definitely worth a few more visits and might become my new favorite neighborhood sushi joint.
Amazing sushi at a good price. Sushi chefs are really friendly and good at what they do. Highly recommend.

This place is amazing! My favorite part is the happy hour from 2-5 & 9-close! The customer service is great! Food taste amazing! Highly recommend the screaming O & California Crunch roll! Soooo delicious! Definitely my new favorite sushi spot!!

Ordered a baked sushi called heart something & it was not baked at all & it did not taste good... the waitress barley spoke English and Everytime we had a question she would just look at us with a blank stare and ask the chef to answer..even though my first experience was bad,  by looking at the reviews this place seems good so I will give it another try one of these days...

First couple times it was great..great service...last time not so much.  Teriyaki chicken was fatty ...tempura was not light..kind of greasy.  Disappointing as we thought we'd found our place for this type of food.  Also the town center location runs a coupon and this location won't accept it. :(

the other night I went to dine in at my local sushi spot before close, upon leaving I accidentally left my keys and wallet. By  the time I had realized I had left my belongings, the restaurant had already closed. So the next morning I went to retrieve my belongings, to find that my money had been removed from my wallet ($200). When I left the establishment that night there was not a single soul in sight. I'm %100 sure that the staff had something to do with this. When I contacted the owner to make them aware of the situation & to ask that they review the cameras.. not just for my satisfaction but to make them aware what kind of employees they have working for them.. he proceeded to raise his voice & argue with me defensively.. stating "nobody touched it" The waitress said she chased me out of the restaurant to give me my wallet and that did not happen. I just wanna spread the word about this horrific event & customer service provided from such establishment.. The manager does not care and did not try to even assess the situation. this place is clearly not a reputable business & I don't believe anyone should ever have to experience this..

Came here after a long day of shopping and a concert. Was ready for some good eats!   Showed up at around 10:30, and we were able to get their happy hour price which are really cheap. We got multiple rolls of everything and some strange dishes called " lasagna sushi", and "monkey brain".   Sushi was served fresh, and I didn't need any sauce, so that's a good indicator on flavor. They have HUGE bowls of Udon for very modest prices.   Decor was also very nice! It was a mini Japan once you walked in. Will definitely go back.
Best sushi in the city. Period. Karai Salad is amazing! Any chef specials are worth getting! Chef is knowledgeable about every fish.

This is my first time here and I'm impressed. The other reviews are correct. Friendly, helpful, EAGER staff. I was checked on often. It's not busy, but theres a thursday crowd.Tasty dishes-I had the Screaming "O", which I am particular about (I like them juicy and tasty ;) ), and it didn't disappoint! I also had the Hamachi Usuzukuri which was reminiscent of a dish I like at Sen of Japan. A tasty vinegaresque hamachi sashimi dish. Sen of Japan's is, of course, more elegant, but this place gives you more meat! Where's the beef! :) And then I have unagi for "dessert", and I've never had anyone eff that up. Come! Come!!

I really hate amending a review, especially when it means I have to take my rating down a notch or two.   This place was my "little gem" on the west side - a delightful little sushi bar with exceptional food.  The thing that made Hokaido Sushi so great was the sushi chef - Eddie, but he's gone now - and so is my love for this place.   The chefs who remain do a marvelous job and the quality of the fish has not diminished one bit, but the magic is gone and the place just isn't the same.  Now, please excuse me while I go over in the corner and have myself a little cry.
Sushi was fresh and very tasty rolls Great service and good atmosphere. Definitely recommended and this place will be on my rotations of places to return too

Sushi doesn't get better then this!   This is the only sushi place we go to because every time we stray away to try new places I'm ALWAYS disappointed. This place has high quality sushi its always fresh and they have a wide variety of specialty rolls which is good for me because that's all I order. The service is top notch and the chefs are fast and friendly.   Some of my favorite rolls include:   What the hell roll Lasagna roll The bikini roll   If your looking for great sushi and good service this is your spot.   Warning they do not have ayce so the bill can get pretty high but like the saying goes you pay for what you get! Our bill is usually around 90 bucks which isn't bad at all it's worth every penny!

The sushi pieces were enormous and delicious- very different combinations from what I have had in the past. My only slight complaint was the order was placed over the phone and when we arrived to pick it up in the recommended time, they hadn't started it. It was late in the evening though and I'm sure they were getting ready to close up but didn't skip on making the sushi!
Came in for the first time, really enjoyed it. We will defnitely be coming here again. Service was great as well.
Good, fresh fish, but nothing special.  Definitely one of the better places I have been to in Las Vegas area.

Amazing. Best sushi I have had in town!!  They are amazing!! Some of the freshest fish I have eaten, and the chefs know what they are doing, and love their jobs.   Would recommend to anyone that wants some good food!!

Oh wow. We stopped by this place after hiking at red rock. We live on the other side of town but it is so worth it! If you like interesting rolls with sauces try the Ultimate tuna, crazy horse, or 3Alarm fire. Bu we also had some sushi pieces. Wow so fresh and huge!

This place was okay. If you want a quick casual sushi bar and it you happen to be hungry and nearby it will suffice.    I tried the Miso Soup which was standard.  Yakitori chicken was ok, nothing special.  The Japanese Lasagna is a creamy rich dish (Baked) Crab, Avo, cream cheese dish which piqed my curiosity.  It was a bit overpowering for my taste buds although I did see where they were trying to go with it.   Overall, average sushi bar with nothing that really set it apart from the rest.

Love this place. Every I come here is a great. New experience.  Some of the best sushi I Vegas. Awesome specials!!!! This is by far one of the best places for sushi in all the valley. The preparation and presentation is amazing. LOVE IT
Always empty but always delicious. I'm not sure if i'm missing their peak hours but i'm not complaining. Sushi chef is always knowledgeable and makes rolls outside of the box.
Great sushi at a great price! We visit at least once a week! The salmon sushi is delicious :)

This Is My All Time Favorite Sushi Bar In Las Vegas Hands Down. I Come Here About 3x A Week, The Sushi Is Always Excellent, The Employees Are Always Nice And Rush To My Needs. It's Always Laid Back And Never Too Busy. Rocky And Su Are My Favorite Sushi Makers And They Are The  Nicest Gentlemen You Will Ever Meet

Service was terrible! The guy went to get a refill and never came back.. Had to ask someone else 10 minutes later. Good took forever and did not come out as ordered. The male waiter was clueless, forgetful, did not know the menu at all.  The food was delicious, but the garlic edamame was soooo spicy (which we weren't informed of it).
This has become my new regular spot. Fresh fish and awesome sushi chefs.   Short staffed so can take a while when busy but worth it
Coming to this place for many years now and I've seen changes come more and more recently. And the changes are not good especially in the service provided very slow

If I could give more stars I would. Incredibly kind and personable staff with a home away from home coziness/feel to the atmosphere AND to top it off: ridiculously consistently cooked food that tastes fresh but is packed with flavor each.and.EVERY.damn.time. :O   Definitely go in during their happy hour for your first visit to take advantage of some of their mainstay dishes for a decent price. Some standout dishes (and the usuals for me) are their: -Salmon Skin Salad -Salmon Miso Kama -Philly Crunch Roll with extra Eel sauce  AND  -their "Jennifer Roll" (a special that you can spot off menu on top of the sushi bar)  This establishment has literally made me reevaluate eating at my typical AYCE restaurant go tos. Nothing even comes close to the quality and the pricing elsewhere.

Really thought that Hokaido would be a thumbs up after reading some great reviews on Yelp...so not sure what happened here!!!! Vegas has high standards for food, so Hokaido has disappointed!!!!  We had an average meal -- the lunch specials were a great price, but took a VERY long time to be served and were nothing really exciting.  The "crazy spicy chicken" tasted like kimchee-drenched onions with some chicken added as an afterthought (not too good!). The chicken katsu was pretty good, but how hard is it to bread chicken in panko and fry it...  If you're looking for great food and good service, I would say that Hokaido is a miss..

Hidden gem of some really good sushi in Vegas.  I was upset beacuse I thought I would never find a sushi place comparable to the Bay Area since I moved to Vegas.  But I finally found one that comes close!  I'm so happy and excited about it!  Must haves: - Garlic Edamame...deep fried and garlicky! - Ebi Crunch...my favorite! - Something Wrong # 69..ain't nothing wrong! haha! - Vegas...no rice but still good  I like how the sushi that does have rice, doesn't really have that much rice!  Sushi is very flavorful, and different!  Hokaido is definitely creative in their sushi creations.  I've also had the agedashi tofu, gyoza, and tempura ice cream.  Appetizers were good, but the ice cream was freezer burned on the inside of the fried shell BOO!  Also, do not order the double hamachi; it totally takes away from the Hamachi and it's way too saucy.  Just get the regular Nigiri Hamachi if you're craving it.  Freshness!  But I still give this place 5 stars!  Go now!  Fort Apache hidden gem!
Me encanto , super recomendable, el resto muy prolijo y el servicio muy agradable... Lo mejor fue que estaba abierto en Navidad !!  Vamos a volver de seguro
Came here for mother's day with the family. Everything was delicious,  the food was fresh and fast. The service was great and the prices were unbeatable.

I have been to coming here a lot of time but not any more. I couldn't get any food ... Korean chef wanna go home and he don't wanna make any. We need to leave. They don't serve you 1 hour before they close .

This was my first time at Hokaido and I heard the food was amazing. We arrived around 1300 and we were seated pretty quick. The food was great and they have this awesome lunch special from 1100-1500 with many choices. I got the salmon teriyaki bento box. It came with rice, miso soup, a salad, 4 California rolls, and the salmon teriyaki.   Food was great but the main issue was the service. The waitress was very sweet, but we literally were waiting for 15 minutes just to get water. I told her our drinks with our food order together so we could just get it at once. It wasn't that busy so I was surprised why it was taking so long. On top of that there were 7 dirty tables around us. They should have the cook help the poor girl out. She was literally sprinting across the restaurant. They need more staff to keep up with flow of people coming into the restaurant. Good food but it's just sad that we had to wait so long to get our order in.

I was in Vegas for work and my co worker told me about Hokaido sushi and i'm sure he did. I thought the sushi overall was very tasty. I especially enjoyed the JJ special roll and the baked mussels. I took off a star due to the service, the waitress forgot to bring us menus and to place our order. I think she may have been new. I definitely would come back though.

Love this place..  2nd time being here but this time i actually got a chance to try some of their sushi instead of their lunch special.  Presentation is beautiful and quality is superb.  This is one of those safe spot if you're looking to try a new sushi place, and uncomfortable leaving your "go to" sushi joint.  Hokaido will not disappoint.  No AYCE here.

Rarely do I show my face in a sushi joint that is not AYCE.  Feeling froggy, I decided to give Hokaido a go based on the Yelp! reviews.  Picked up a to-go order of Mexican Roll and 3 Alarm Fire Roll.  Both were excellent.  I agree with everyone who mentioned how beautiful the presentation is.  Even in a to-go box, they made it look really cool.  Didn't hurt that it also tasted really good.

We went tonight based on all the great reviews and they were right this place is Great! We loved the service and their sushi is fresh and taste absolutely amazing. This will definetly be one of our new sushi places.

My favorite Sushi spot in Vegas!  The fish freshness and quality is as good as anyone could hope for inland, and beats out a lot of old favorites in Cali.  The chefs are fun and talented, and the restaurant is always clean and inviting.  The focus here is where it ought to be: the sushi.  Red Bean Mochi FTW!

Only have come here for their bento, not any rolls or nigiri, and they're delicious! There's a lot to choose from so that may be why the bento is a bit more expensive. However you find it more than reasonable after the taste. I took my little cousin here for lunch and she loved it more than most other Japanese places we've been to. Can't say anything about their sushi, but their bentos are great!

Great fresh tasting fish! The tiger roll and the most key brains are delish!!! The Poki salad has really nice size pieces of tuna and great seaweed salad mixed in. Tonight I tried the Butter Nipple and it had a great taste especially with garlic sauce. Only down fall is they don't have an all you can eat option here at all.
I love eating here every time I visit Vegas! The food is fresh and delicious. My favorites include the Mexican, lobster, and Vegas rolls...but there's soo much to choose from.

Great sushi place for date nights. The staff was very friendly and attentive during our meal, always refilling our drinks and taking away empty plates in time. The prices are a bit on the expensive side but I wasn't disappointed with my meal. All in all, a great restaurant

I love Hokaido Sushi. It's close by home so we definitely come here often if we need a quick sushi fix. I went here for lunch and they have some good lunch box options. I ordered the Beef Bulgogi which includes 4 pieces California Roll, Salad, Rice and Miso Soup. My aunt ordered the Chicken Teriyaki and she was impressed with it since there was not an overabundance of sauce. We also ordered salmon nigri, sweet shrimp, the Unaten Roll and the Grand Canyon roll. The sushi was delicious as always and its definitely a place to try. It's not an all you can eat place, but I think the sushi more than makes up for it.

YES! An amazing sushi joint right next to my place that tastes great and has even better prices. Check out the happy hour menu, it's off the chain. I went with my mom around 2:30 on a Thursday and my boyfriend later joined us. We had the whole place to ourselves, which was perfect.  5 dollar large Saporros to start, 2 dollar edamame... Then the rolls. Oh, the rolls. We got California rolls, spicy tuna, spicy salmon, shrimp tempura and an order of octopus sushi. Everything was absolutely delicious. I actually don't really like fish, because it's always too fishy tasting: aka old. Well, for the first time in my life I ate a little (or lot) of everything and enjoyed every single last bite. And our bill? Under 50 bucks. (Half was beer... Oops.) Thank you for the stellar service, wonderful food and great vibe. I will be back again. And again. And again.

We've been coming to Hokaido for a couple years now. We really like the place because 1. They are super friendly 2. You get more bang for your buck here; quality, presentation & service.  The staff, like most sushi restaurants, greet you right away, but they don't  look miserable doing it at this place lol. They remember us everytime we go there and the sushi chefs even take the time out to talk to us.   The food is average, in price but very quality sushi and the presentation is awesome! They use anything from flowers, radish, leaves but the thing that really impressed me the most was the radish that they carved into a butterfly! I have a photo but I can't find my cord for camera! I know, a big FAIL for me. lol  The restaurant itself is quite small, not really ideal if you have more than 6 people but it's a great place if you're looking to have some quality sushi!

I love Hokaido.  A great neighbor restaurant!.  The service is always top notch!  I took my friend for a pre-concert dinner on Sunday.  We sat at the sushi bar and started off with Sapporos in frosty, ice cold mugs!  We ordered the Blue Fin Toro - melt in your mouth deliciousness.  We followed with I love my Ass, Hawaiian and Dark Horse - incredible sauces;  tasty fish - Awesome!
Best presentation in town on sushi - kinda a hidden gem!  Sushi is awesome and doesn't get to crowded.  Didn't have one sushi I didn't like!
Had the lobster roll, red mountain roll, and the Philadelphia roll. Pricey but everything tasted great! Would give 5 stars if they had ayce to save me a few bucks.

Excellent quality sushi. They are the real deal. When they served pickled wasabi on my sushi i just knew it was gonna be the real deal. Downfall.... There was o it one waitress during lunch rush. I will still go back. I highly recommend this place. And they have lunch box specials for $6.95... Now that's a deal.

The food here is amazing. I've only had sushi though so idk about the bento food. The only thing that makes me drop one star is the lack of knowledge that the servers have. Every time I asked a question about the menu like "what sauce comes on this roll?" She would have to go ask the sushi chef and it would take like 5 mins just to find out something simple. As a server, they should know better. But that's why I like to sit at the sushi bar bc they would be able to answer my questions. But overall, I really do love this place and I will continue coming back to eat.

Every single time I return to this restaurant, it is always consistent, and great. The service is excellent and they are always extremely friendly.   Last time my son and I came here we tried the Tempura Cheese Cake, which was a rich, delicious dessert. We, to say the least, devoured it.  Even if the food wasn't as good as it is, I would go in just for the love all the staff shares! Thank you for caring about your guests!
Best sushi in town. Been a fan since 2008. The whole staff is great. I rather spend the extra dollars than all you can eat.
I've been coming to Hokkaido for a couple years now and it has the best sushi in town. Additionally the service is excellent and the waitress's are very kind. Their happy hour is also a great value.

This place has become one of my once a week spots for sushi!! It's the real deal with good fresh fish. I don't usually eat rolls, and it's hard to find sashimi and sushi with the right quality. These guys know what they are doing.

This place is by far the best sushi I've ever had still to this day, it's 5 mins from my house which is even better, I just wish they still had all you can eat. I don't know why they got rid of that in the first place. But awesome food !!

Disappointing! I guess I had high hopes for this place after reading the reviews.   I had mushroom miso, It was flavorful but they used dried shitake mushrooms which I'm not a fan of. I love fresh shitake mushrooms though.   We ordered Tuna Poke, Hamachi Usuzukuri, Mango Salmon, Kiwi Salmon and Sexy Monkey.   I thought Tuna Poki, Hamachi and Sexy Monkey were pretty flavorful to me. As for Mango and Kiwi Salmon, both were bit different, mango didn't taste ripe to me. Kiwi had avocado that wasn't ripe either and crab stick in it and I end up having this crab wrapper in my mouth, hence minus a star.   Despite that they had friendly staff, I wouldn't go back again for the food as I've been there twice...

Sushi was not bad. Wonderful service. Garlic edamame was delicious.  Thank you to Young for being so sweet and friendly even though we were a pain in the ass. She made me a custom spicy sauce and made no fuss when we had a disagreement on an order.  Thank you Young!

This Sushi restaurant is absolutely my favorite!!! Quality of food is really good and Sushi chef and server gave us good recommendation!!  They have lots of variety of speciality rolls and we tried Dragon and Red Rock and other rolls I don't remember.. Sashimi salad is also must to eat!! They got so many appetizer and I definitely come back here over AYCE since they have fresh and tasty fish. Price of food is not bad at all!! I really recommend this restaurant. The Sushi Chef, Sue is so nice and kind. We will come back to see him.

Great food, and a decent happy hour menu.  We sat at the bar and rocky was our chef. He was awesome, he made us several amazing rolls and even gave us a complimentary yellow tail appetizer.  He also gave us a small desert as well on the house. We will definitely go back soon.

I liked this place a lot but if you are used to AYCE, this place might sting your wallet a bit.  The rolls are amazing and the fish quality is very good, but it's a only a notch or two better than Jjanga or Sushi Koma.  I would still recommend though, because they have an awesome Screaming Orgasm salad - you may want to ask for them to leave the furikake seasoning off of it, because it tasted weird to me.  Nigiri was just okay, and I would probably skip it next time.    Happy Hour menu is not as great of a deal as some other places.  Prices looks great until you realize it's for half rolls.  But it works out to be a $2-3 discount on a selection of $12-13 rolls.

The best sushi in Vegas. Superb Japanese authentic sushi in town. The food is really really good, it's to die for. The sushi and sashimi are top notch. Service was excellent, the hostess and waitresses are very friendly and accommodating. I would recommend Hokaido Sushi at Fort Apache for everyone.

We walked in early on Thursday evening and were immediately greeted.  We were getting sushi to go.   The sushi chef told me to step on up and he took our order.  It was delicious.  Very fresh, very flavorful.  We are not AYCE people, so we thought sushi amounts and prices were fine.  We live close and will definitely go back and sit at the bar.

Hokaido Sushi has one of the most creative and nicely garnished sushi I've seen.  Our group didn't order any nigri (except for Uni) or sashimi, so I really couldn't gauge the true freshness of the fish. Nothing had the bad fishy taste, so I'll give them the okay in that department.  * Gyoza - It was good, but Ichiza's gyoza is much better. The waitress said it was pan fried, but I have my doubts based on the crispiness of the skin. The crispiness took away some of the flavors away from the gyoza.  * Yellowtail Appetizer - I believe this was the yellowtail with some jalepeno, garlic, and onions. Refreshing and clean tasting.  * Uni - fresh and creamy with a nice golden yellow color. delicious.  * Surf & Turf - This has a nice piece of steak on top of the sushi. Taste wise it works very well. You may not like the texture since the steak on top isn't as soft as eating a fish.  * House Special Spicy Hokaido - This thing was fairly hot, killing my taste buds. Good thing it was at the end of the meal. Maybe a less spicy roll with less chili paste and jalape√±o wouldn't kill the taste of it.   * Bikini, Red Rock, Something Wrong #69 - All of these were good. No complaints.  Service could have been better. We were missing 2 placemats in our group of 4. She forgot one of our orders, which is hard to believe considering we didn't order that much. She wasn't very attentive even when we were the only group in the sushi bar. She was not filling up our drinks in a timely manner or wasn't there when we needed something. She didn't seem to have any knowledge of the house special rolls, having to rely on the sushi chefs. While she was very kind and friendly, she seems very inexperienced. This should be an easy fix for the business if they're reading this.  This place uses a lot of garnish, even more garnish than the sushi and has a lot of creative rolls that are actually executed right. Every sushi plate that came out truly looks like an artwork. If you're with someone who likes their sushi visually pleasing or some more creative rolls, this is the place to go.

This is our go-to sushi place. We love it in here--it's small, it's never loud, and the sushi is always fresh and delicious. The service is good--we've been here dozens of times, and we've never had a bad experience. The complimentary cucumber salad at the beginning of the meal is wonderful!  We never do the 'happy hour' menu--let's get real, it's not really a happy hour as it's half the roll for half the price. We just order from the regular menu and stay happy :)

I wish I could give this place more stars for how much you could tell they were trying to please customers as much as they could, but I would rather leave an honest review.   Very friendly and attentive staff, the only downfall is that if you're planning to save money by ordering off the happy hour menu, you might as well just order all you can eat at your local sushi spot instead. Ended up paying almost $60 in happy hour items for two (and we are not very big eaters!) -- when you can probably just get more bang for your buck, with more variety, elsewhere. I would try this place again maybe sometime in the future, just not raving to go again.

food is always delicious. the hibachi fried rice is my go to order and my favorite thing to get. the ramen broth is also very flavorful and not a lot of fat. most of the time there is only one waitress, so the service is slow since it tends to be busy.

My fave sushi place! Seafood here is really fresh. I love the variety in the menu. Happy Hour has an amazing selection and is very affordable. My favorite is their Homemade Tamago Nigiri and the Salmon Skin Handroll.  The owner is a great guy. Very friendly and down to earth. We love coming here any time of day.

One of my favorite sushi places in Las Vegas. From great foods, to great happy hour prices, cold beer, and Angela. Honestly for me, her service is what brought me back the second time, and the 10th, and 20th. Very friendly and on top of everything. It never seems to be full, but I wouldn't want it any other way. Only thing missing is AYCE, but with their happy hour, you won't be going home with empty pockets, just a full belly.

Omg this restaurant was nothing better than AYCE restaurants. A la carte sushi restaurants should have better quality of fish but not at all... Their price was A la carte but quality was ayce. I just tried sushi ne*o in China town and their nigiris were so much better. And a waitress was so rude, no eye contact! she just took our order and turned away without letting us finished. I could tell that we were irritating her so bad because we wanted to order more food. Horribly trained staff because they gave us happy hour menu and when we were ready to order that rude waitress just snatched the happy hour menu and said they're not available. F*** this place I will never return. I will spread my bad experience to everyone I know.

Really good sushi here folks.  The fish tasted good and the chef's creations were nice and yummy.  I'll be moving around this area in the next few months and I am happy there is a sushi bar so close, you will see more of me Hoaido.

Unclean, sloppy, and prepare for a belly ache if you get their "fresh" oysters.  The chef owner has a lot of personality and this used to be a locals hot spot before the wave of AYCE sushi hit town.  However, for the sake of your precious office sick days and your sensitive organs, I recommend going for the many other AYCE in town with better hygiene and quality of fresh seafood.

I had to reduce my previous 5 star rating. Today, the fiod sucked. This never hsppened in the last 2 plus years i've been going here. Either the owners or the cook changed. There is no other explanation. If there is a good explanation, i'll listen...

YUM! Probably the best rolls I've ever had thus far. The variety here is intense! There were so many to choose from, but the 3 we chose were all very delicious.  We had the Unaten roll which included shrimp tempura, avocado, eel etc. Vegas roll that was deep fried and included the perfect amount of cream cheese, just a tad! and the Sweetheart Roll which our sushi chef recommended, it's "baked" meaning they torch it to "bake" the top salmon, it also included spicy crab, shrimp tempura, and roe. It was full of flavor and very delicious  Although the quality of the food was fantastic, the minor problems here are: -The drive is definitely quite away from the strip, about 8 miles? We were in the mood for some good sushi so yelped led the way. -each specialty roll was about $12-$13, 3 of which added up to $40 pre-tip altogether for two -- a little on the steep side these days  Service was really friendly and fun, and there wasn't a wait at all! They're open pretty late too on a Sunday.. til 11pm

We decided to try Hokaido Sushi because we have wanted to kinda get out of the rut of always going to the same place because there is "this ONE roll I like that I haven't seen elsewhere". Hokaido had a given perk in its favor when it came down to where we were going to experiment next - It isn't far from home, up on Fort Apache. We saw the excellent reviews second so it was a go. I am a roll fan (so I guess I would be considered not to be an aficionado when it comes to sushi) but we enjoyed the selection of rolls and the flexibility we were allowed in substituting here and there with contents and toppers for the rolls (spicy crab in lieu of Spicy Tuna; Rainbow rolls with Jalapenos rolled on the inside, etc) We found several rolls to our liking and were very pleased with the presentation, the time it took to be served, the kindness of our waitress (who was willing to help my newbie brother out with a chopsticks cheater tool :-)) We will definitely be going back because there is just so much more on the menu we would like to try. We had a really hard time making our minds up for this round.

Hokaido simply kicks ass for sushi. We drove a darn good distance from the strip to try this place and we did not come away disappointed. This has to be my favorite sushi place in Vegas. Just super fresh fish, a sushi chef that was unafraid to recommend some simply great fish and a casual, chill atmosphere.   What made Hokaido stand out was the Aji and Toro we had. Just super fresh and flavorful cuts of fish, meticulously prepared, and sushi rice was spot-on. We consulted the sushi chef several times and he had some excellent recommendations. My only regret was that they were out of Kohada when I was there. Oh well. Even more reason to go back!

I guess if you are not stuck on the idea that your sushi rolls should contain raw fish, then this place is good.  All the "special rolls" that are priced anywhere from $9.95 to $15.00 contain either crab meat or shrim tempura, both of those are extremely cheap and not very tasty ingredients.  I understand thats how sushi bar makes the money, but if you price a roll at $14.95, at least put raw fish on the inside and on the outside.  Ultimate tuna roll is the only roll with raw tuna on the inside and the outside.  Considering that I was there on a Monday, my rolls and nigiri should not have had a slight fishy smell, yet they did........so fish was not super fresh.  Presentation is nice though, but if the food are not tasty, who cares.......I suppose if you dont care what you get in your rolls then this place is for you.  I would rather drive for 25 minutes to go to I Love Sushi on Eastern Ave
Wow is all I can say.  Some of the BEST sushi I've had in a very long time.  I was thoroughly impressed by the quality.  Everything I ordered was amazing

Great sushi bar in this part of town. Had a sashimi platter and a sushi combo that was shared by 3 people and it was more than enough food.  Not a fan of their Yum Yum scallop roll but the dragon roll was presented beautifully and tasted equally good.  Service was very friendly each time I've gone there. I try to go here at least once or twice a week.

Love, love this spot!  We've been here over 5 times within the last couple of monthly.  We love the service here.  Everyone is super friendly and attentive.  The food is amazing.  Every dish we order was fresh and the right amount of sauce blend.  Our favorites are the Screaming "O", Dark Horse, and the cucumber wrap roll.
This place is wayyyy bomb. Superior to JJANGA in every way, they do NOT HAVE AYCE, cuz quality. Alley was our server, super nice & attentive. Will be back boiiiiii

Really good place for sushi . I ordered take away over the phone 30 min later I arrived to the place but my order wasn't ready  So I waited 10 More min , I was a little bit upset but once I got home and start eating I realize that it was  worth it :) . All fresh and great flavors. will definitely will eat there again
This is one of our favorite sushi restaurant. The specials were amazing. Rocky gave us great recommendations. Loved the king salmon nagiri sushi!

I've only been here twice now and I think it's good but nothing too great.. And to be quite honest I think the portions and cuts are little on the smaller side.. They have a huge specialty roll menu starting at around $9..  They also have lunch special bento boxes which is a plus.. We ordered salmon & chicken Katsu but they accidentally gave us beef instead of salmon.. They apologized and corrected the mistake.. Oh well, free teriyaki beef!... Too bad it was a bit on the chewy side..   Their spicy tuna is spicer than other places so be careful!!!  Another thing I've noticed about this place is that the food takes a long time to come out...  I'll probably be back again since its close to my house.. But like I said.. It was nothing too special for me..  On the plus side: free green tea ;)))

I came here on a Friday night with 2 of my friends. About 10 minutes after we ordered my friend received her Bento Box, which was awesome. 20 minutes went by and my and I have yet to receive our order of sushi.   Now for a Friday night I can understand why it would take a while to receive our order, but there was only 2 other groups eating there. A third group came in and they received their order quickly after they ordered yet it was 30 minutes for us to receive our sushi roles.   Now I understand why it was empty on a Friday night. Highly dissatisfied and will not be recommending this place to my friends or will I be eating here again.

This is my favorite sushi joint around. My wife and I try to make it here as much as we can. We always come here during happy hour. The happy hour menu has a lot of selections and the prices are very good too. My wife and I can get super full and not have it hurt my wallet. I would recommend this place to anyone. This place proves that you don't need to go and spend hundreds of dollars to eat good sushi.   I wish they offered an all you can eat.  Overall I am very satisfied with this place, and I am positive that we will continue eating here for as long as we live in Vegas.   If you are just visiting Vegas, it is worth the trip to come to this place. Great food, great staff, and a clean and quiet location.
Driving by stopped in just for some take out, first time there. As I waited for my order I was offered water and edamame. Delicious food, prompt, excellent service .  Definitely will be back

The BF and I and some friends went for dinner during their late night happy hour (starts at 10pm- 2am).   Rolls were served 4 pieces to a order.   We got salmon skin roll ($2.75) - decent,  but standard. I like the beet butterfly they did as garnish - pretty.   Hawaiian roll (around $5.25) - pretty decent again, but standard. It has spicy tuna, wrapped in various fish with ponzu.   It didnt seem happy hour was much of a deal generally, there were a few items on major discount. It can make for good variety since its half rolls but once you add up 2x orders its close to the normal roll price. Theres no happy hour menu or mention of it on their site, but its a select menu of alcohol, rolls, and some appetizers on special. The sake bombs were a good deal though, I believe $3.  At this point we decide going with a dinner bento is probably best than going all happy hour.    We shared a 3 item combo -  *Albacore sashimi (5pc) - it was pretty fresh actually,  no complaints there. *Tonkatsu - nicely crisp, it was a bit dry.  *Spicy chicken - was Korean style with onions, zucchini, and chicken in a spicy sauce. It wasn't too spicy though but it was flavorful.    Miso soup and salad that comes with is again, decent but standard fare.   Service was fairly decent.   Its not bad but its not great. I would say it was all pretty average Americanized Japanese.  I think if thats what you were craving you can probably find a good meal here. I guess with the reviews I was expecting something more.

Although a bit pricey, the sushi here is delicious and the presentation is the nicest I've ever seen!  Excellent quality and fresh fish!  I got the bulgogi-don when I was there and it was so good.  Rice covered in sauce, Korean style bulgogi, and veggies.  Very homey and delicious.   I also ordered a California roll just to try.  It came out on a beautiful platter with orchids.  What?  Just for a California roll?  Nice!  My husband got one of the bento boxes.  The beef teriyaki isn't awesome, just OK... but the sushi that came with it was so good!    All in all, if I want to stuff my face with sushi, I might go to a cheaper place like Kobe (another one of our frequented spots)... but if I'm looking for a nice relaxing dinner with quality sushi, I'll come back here!

Wow. I mean, wow. Skilled, artful presentation and fresh ingredients. Veg tempura roll w/brown rice was absolutely incredible - so many other sushi places produce tempura rolls that fall apart, but mine stayed deliciously intact. The hibachi rice is something I'm dedicated to trying to replicate at home. My husband had the kamikaze roll and said he was confident he'd picked the best roll on the menu.   Service was attentive and friendly, we can't wait to go back! Our new favorite place in Vegas and worth the quick drive off the strip!
I love this place because it is peaceful.The server is great.Fried rice is good taste.Also the happy hour is 9pm-closed.
This place is delicious!  Every sushi dish that we had was thoroughly enjoyed. The service is terrible!  But that can be overlooked because every dish is delicious
The great thing about this place is the rolls!! There are so many different varieties. Also they have great oysters on a Friday night
Not as we thoughts.  Food is very different than on the photos.  Service is not the best.  She threw dishes to the table, no smile,  etc.  Vegetable tempura sushi was pasty.

Every time my wife and I go here, it is fantastic. She always gets the what the hell roll and others, and I usually get the ebon crunch. It is always fresh, service is great, I can't recommend it enough.

Cute neighborhood sushi spot.  Nothing too fancy, pretty down to earth.    Went there for the happy hour, the price was really good and with plenty of selections.  However I think the sushi bar is doing a better job than the hot kitchen.  Hot dishes were so so and honestly kinda overcooked.    We had spider roll, that was yummy!  Shrimp/ veg tempura and agedashi tofu were good.  And that's pretty much it.  The fried gyoza was greasy & rubbery.  Salmon miso kama was too well done.  Yakitori was blended.    We definitely will go back because the servers were awesome.  Just avoid ordering hot dishes.  lol

Hokaido has been our neighborhood sushi spot for a couple of years now and we have a pleasant experience every time we go. The staff and sushi chefs are always welcoming...they even know us and our kids by name! The fish is always fresh and the service is timely. We love going to Hokaido. And we HIGHLY recommend you give them a try!

I am a sushi snob. Bring a California girl I couldn't imagine good sushi in the desert. I was so wrong! The sushi was some of the most delicious ice ever eaten. The presentation was wonderful, portions filling, and the taste was FRESH! It took some time waiting for the sushi to arrive but they gave us complementary cucumber and crab salad and some edamame, good things take some time to prepare anyway.  I will make it a point to eat here when visiting family again. I'm getting hungry just thinking of it.

I have been here many times and while I use to come back because the sushi was good, the service has always left me disappointed. Today was probably the last time I will go here. We came around 915pm, and while there was about 5 other tables already there, at about 935, we decided to leave.  No one got our drink order, asked us if we wanted to order or anything. Service has always been slow but this was the final straw.

Can't review sushi, as we did not eat here.   Went to Hokaido for date night with my wife, we walked in to restaurant, two sushi chefs at bar were leaning on prep area with elbows playing games on their phones. After they noticed we were watching them, they both dropped to the floor to continue to play their games. We took that as a sign, paid for our drink and quickly left. I guess our first clue should have been that we were one of two tables at dinner time.   Not at all what I would expect walking into a sushi restaurant, went to Sushi Fever on Sahara, sat in a packed house and had a great dinner.  Never going back to Hokaido.

It's been years since I ate here last, mostly because of the location but nonetheless I was on this side of town and decided to stop by. I was quickly greeted and asked for a table. There were only 2 other tables of people dining which made for a quick turn around on my sushi order. The salmon nigiri melted in my mouth it was so fresh and sweet. The ikura was small but tasty and the roll I ordered was executed perfectly. The roll was called the "I love my ass" roll. With chopped soft shell crab inside and yellowtail to top, it came with a sweet yet tart mustard sauce. The waitress was attentive and kept my drink refilled. I'll agree that for a non-ayce sushi place, the prices are a bit high. Uni was $12 or $14.50 for a premium version. My bill was $28 after a 20% tip. I noticed the happy hour menu which seems very reasonably priced.

We've been to Hokaido on 2 different occasions. The sushi chefs and the waitresses have all been very friendly and funny with our 1 year old, very kid friendly.  Our sushi and sashimi have both been very good. Fresh, good quality and a good sized portion. I think they're the best sushi option in the SW part of town and would recommend you giving them a try.  As a side note I called asking if they had a highchair for children and they confirmed that they did. When we arrived at the restaurant 10 minutes later they had our table waiting with the highchair already in place. That's good service!

A bit pricy for the small portions. Food came out slow, although restaurant was almost empty. The two waitress kept coming by our table about a dozen times after we had ordered, yet no food. And the quality of the food was just average at best.  The sushi and rice tasted a bit firm. We were not quite done with one of our rolls when the waitress insisted to take the plate away. I said we're still working on that last piece, and she suggested we can move that roll over to the other plate. WTH??  Menus were hard to read and we felt rushed to order and to finish, even though the restaurant was pretty much empty.  Will not be returning, there are better choices out there in the LV area.

Just randomly stopped here for lunch and was so pleasantly surprised. Great prices especially for lunch. Very fresh sushi and well preprepared. If I lived in this neighborhood I'd eat here twice a week.

I'm a fan! The staff is really friendly & answer any questions you might have. The ambiance is nice. Dimly lit with fishies hanging with some net from the ceiling. Paper lanterns. The fish was REALLY fresh. I like the idea of them not having AYCE. Most places that have AYCE really lack the freshness in their fish. Ordered the Hawaiian Roll, Caterpillar Roll, Dragon Roll & the Lobster Roll. I LOVED the Hawaiian Roll & the Lobster Roll! You could really taste the freshness of the tuna in the Hawaiian, & the Lobster had this great sauce on top! Very friendly staff & great food! Will definitely be returning customers.

HOLY SASHIMI BATMAN!!!  The best sushi place Vegas! I eat sushi at least once a week and this is probably the best in town. I have eaten at numerous local sushi places throughout Vegas and some of the upper scale places on the strip and this place ranks high among the top! if not THEE BEST! LIKE A PARTY IN MY MOUTH! From the moment you walk in the staff greet you with a sincere and warm welcome. Ya know,  when they yell something that you have no idea what it means, but it sounds good?  They go out of there way to make you feel at home. The sushi bar is a great spot to sit and watch Sushi Chef Eric. It is a pleasure to watch him work his magic and make some of the most beautiful and delicious rolls. Every dish is a masterpice with intricate garnishes full of art, all hand carved and made to order. He spends his time laying every roll down perfectly to ensure that the presentation is just as visually appealing as it tastes. Gyoza is a great appetizer to order, make sure to get it deep fried for extra crunchiness. The sweet heart roll brings all the great elements together of hot and cold, sweet and salty, and soft and crunchy. The rice is perfectly cooked and holds the roll together, it is topped with fresh salmon broiled with a flame thrower right before it is served.   I've read some of the reviews on this place and yes it is a little on the higher price point, BUT C'MON!! If you are a true sushi fanatic, you know you pay for freshness!! You can't even get ALL YOU CAN EAT here. Ya know why!? BECAUSE ITS QUALITY!!   If you see me at the sushi bar, buy me a drink. Preferably a sake bomb.

Have ordered from here quite a few times and never had a problem until tonight . I placed an order for 2 orders of California Rolls at 10:17 . The lady on the phone told me 20-25 min . This is much longer then usual but no big deal . Got to the restaurant , Paid , tipped , then was told 10 more minutes . I went and sat with my husband in the car, waited the 10 minutes then went back in . I waited 3-4 minutes and no one came up to the front so I went back and sat in car for a few more minutes. When I went back in it had been 35 minutes since I placed this very small order . The lady tells me it's going to be another 10 minutes . At this point I'm frustrated because there were people that had come into the restaurant after I got there to dine in that were being served sushi but I couldn't get my order ?!? I told the lady I would just take a refund . She didn't know how to give a refund so she had to call someone on the phone to figure it out. It took 10 minutes just to get the refund and obviously the California rolls still weren't ready . This was ridiculous . If you can't fulfill an order, you could tell me on the phone instead of wasting my time , gas , and sanity ! NEVER AGAIN ! Oh, and don't tip BEFORE you get your order like I did . It cost me a couple bux in the end to be treated like a second class citizen because I wasn't dining in I suppose . Thanks for the 50 minute waste of my time .

As a picky sushi eater - I'm always reluctant to try new places, but after reading the reviews we had to check this place out. From the outside it doesn't look like much. It's in a strip mall and if you're not looking you'd pass right by. When we drove up I thought I'd be let down.  When we walked in I was under impressed by the decor (which is why I give it 4 stars, atmosphere means a lot to me). But we were instantly greeted by the sushi chefs with some sort of call out, which was fun and welcoming. We were instantly seated and although the place was slow (only one other couple there) it was clean and pleasant.  After we ordered we were brought a really tasty cucumber salad. It was so good we asked for seconds, and got it no problem, with no extra charge. Our waitress was sweet and very patient. We took a long time to figure out what we wanted, and we ordered twice because we wanted more.  The menu is entertaining, with names like 'I love my ass'. We ordered that along with  'something's wrong with 69', "monkey brains' and 'slippery nipple' (I think these were the names). We added some tuna and salmon sashimi and all in all we trilled with our choices! The '69' and the 'nipple' were amazing!!  This is now one of our new favorite places, the pricing was reasonable and the food was amazing. I would highly recommend.

I've been to Hokaido twice for there late night happy hour that goes from 9 pm to close and I loved it! At that hour it's not too packed and the service is great everyone is very friendly and helpful. With the happy hour you get bogo sake!! Can't beat that! They have a delicious lasagna roll, usually I can't handle the richness of a lasagna roll but Hokaidos is on point! Pretty much everything I've tried there I've enjoyed. My friend also tells me that they serve fish heads, I don't think there on the menu and I've never tried them but she says they're delicious. Just in case your feeling adventurous.

I was introduced to Hokaido Sushi by a friend earlier this year, and it immediately became my go-to sushi place.  While some of the rolls I've tried haven't been to my personal taste, they've always been very high quality.  My husband doesn't eat sushi, so he orders other things off the menu and has enjoyed the food every time.  I have two kids, one preschool aged and one elementary school aged, and the staff makes them feel very welcomed.  It's always wonderful to find a restaurant where my kids are thrilled to go.
Sam is awesome.  Great prices and friendly staff!  Try the hot sake...yum!  Our sone love the lunch box.
Katsu chicken - delicious. Sushi - Quality of fish solid, but not outstanding. Beer - well priced. Go!
Love this place! Nothing is not good here! My first sashimi I ate here it's so good melts in your mouth. Their hot green tea is one of a kind!

After giving this place a bad review a few years ago, me and my wife came back to try it out since its close to the house. And to our surprise their food gotten better and now they have ramen bowls which I crave for! I'll be coming back to this place again,

Awesome Awesome place.  The ambiance is awesome, the staff is so friendly.  We go about once a week, because that is the only place we will go now :)  The sushi is amazing, have the specials the muchi muchi is the best!   They even cut up avocado and give us rice for my toddler to keep her entertained :) I would highly suggest this to anyone looking for a great sushi place.

If you like sushi - this is a must GO place. You should ask for the specials because the head chef gets top of the shelf sushi from all over the world. Simply amazing food, service and great atmosphere

The sushi itself was pretty decent - nothing too extravagant.   I went here with 4 girlfriends for happy hour which the pricing was great, but the number of rolls was disappointing. The main reason why I rated this place a 2 is the service.  We asked if the rolls could be given together based on who ordered what. The server stated she was giving them to us on which ones came out first to avoid having us wait for our food, but I mean.. if we requested them to be served that way why not cater to your customers request? In any case, we ended up having to fish around other dishes to put our own orders together.  As we were paying, the same server was arguing with one of my girlfriends about an order being served, but my friend did not receive the order.  Overall.. The sushi was average. The service - well, I've experienced better.

Was there for lunch super fresh fish,my server was very nice and attentive.i order a chef sashimi and chef Sam put a very delicious and fresh fish on my plate , nice little place a little too far from my house but definitely I will be back again.thanks chef Sam

Me and my three frienda found this, leaving LV after our spring break weekend. The sushi was rather cheap, and tasted fantastic! Two of us wefe vegetarian, the owner madr several tasty rolls for us.  We also got complementary japanese ice creams when we were done eating, so tasty!  I'm not a sushi expert, but I love decent sushi amd this place was a great restaurant to end our break!!

My boyfriend used to live near Hokaido, so when I mentioned I was craving sushi one evening but wanted a casual dinner.... he said he knew just the place and brought me to his go to sushi place.  I really enjoyed Hokaido. It is a great neighborhood restaurant. When we arrived it was a lil before the dinner rush, so we were immediately seated at the bar.  We ordered large Sapporos to start the dinner off and they were severed in frosty ice cold mugs! We were then served a delicious cucumber salad while we made our sushi choices.  My boyfriend prefers sashimi and I prefer rolls, so he ordered the salmon and fatty tuna (which he said we delicious), and I ordered The Sweetheart Roll and The Dark Horse roll.  Everything was delicious! I would definitely recommend these  two rolls- I will be ordering them again!  The location is small, it wasn't loud, great atmosphere, and the sushi was fresh and delicious. The service was great, our waitress was very attentive and the chefs we so personable and fun, great casual conversation. I can't wait to go back!

For a local sushi bar that is not trying too hard, they do an amazing job with absolutely amazing quality fish and a great staff. If you're looking for the fanciest new fusion cuisine, you're not going to find it here, but you will find the best quality sushi in Las Vegas and some really innovative dishes from a staff that loves their food.  All the sushi chefs are amazing, to be honest, but sit with JJ who has his own local following of Sushi Lovers who think he's the best sushi chef in Vegas. He's pretty good and deserve almost of his own restaurant on the Strip.
Friendly staffs,Great food and awesome atmosphere!They are offering Happy hour after 9 pm till close.

I think I have found a new sushi spot and it's conveniently down the street from my house! Seriously some of the best rolls I have ever had. I recommend getting the Dark Horse and the Buttery Nipple roll! If you like baked rolls, Sweetheart was delicious. I ordered to go so I'm rating solely on the sushi not the service of the place.

Went in for a quick business lunch. Small mall location, but was nice inside. Ordered spicy tuna with tuna topped rolls and a round of nigiri. Everything was very good! A bit on the pricey side compared to others, but not bad for the quantity and taste. Happy Hour prices look very good. My customer is from Hawaii and didn't like salmon, never have seen a Hawaiian turn down fish. i talked him into trying the nigiri..He liked it!  Menu looked awesome. Will go back and hit it hard one of these nights..
Great food and service. Love Su and Rocky, the best chefs ever.
Awesome spot! Sam and Rocky are the best! They always accommodate and exceed our expectations. Service is always good!

If sushi was kung-fu, their kung-fu is very strong.  Hokaido is what every sushi place should be about, really great sushi!  This isn't AYCE, but quality sushi that is worth the price you pay. They have the usual sushi rolls you expect and all their sexually suggestive names but the cheeky roll names aside they take great pride in their fish and it shows with every delectable bite from the rice they use to the quality of the seaweed paper.  Oddly, I'm a huge fan of the Mango Salmon roll which is odd since  I don't really like Mango.  These Sushi Wizards have found a way to package what was once a shunned fruit into something I order regularly.  That's talent!  Friendly service although at times can be slowed down when really busy, I'm very pleased with this establishment and count myself as a regular.

I love coming here. We come here almost everyday! The service is great and the food is consistently excellent. I love the quality of seafood. Always fresh and tastes delicious. The owner is very hands on and is great with customers. I highly recommend this place especially for Happy Hour!

No All-U-Can-Eat, No Me-Come-Back.  Came for lunch and paid $17 for the sushi/sashimi combo.  Small miso soup, 6 pieces of sashimi & 4 standard pieces of sushi.  Aside from the very nice waitress, not impressed & still hungry.  Might as well go elsewhere for a $20 all-u-can-eat sushi lunch.
